Egna María L. V. inicio con la venta de ropa de niños como vio que era rentable decidió ofrecer otros productos como ropa para adultos, prendas y perfumes. En la actualidad comercializa más las prendas y perfumes  en lo cual invertirá el préstamo.

Ella hace un año aproximadamente que empezó a trabajar con Adim como miembro de un grupo solidario y ahora se graduó a individual.
texts.en: Egna María L. V. started by selling children's clothes, and as she saw that it was profitable, she decided to offer other products such as clothing for adults, garments, and perfumes.  Currently, she markets the garments and perfumes more, and it is in these that she will invest the loan.  About one year ago, she began working with ADIM as a member of the community bank, and how she has graduated to individual loans.

loans.use: Garments and perfumes

loans.name: Fely Laranjo's Group

texts.en:
Fely L. is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Misom, a part of the barangay of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Fely is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fely runs a grocery store. She has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fely is requesting a new loan, her fifth from PMPC, of 14,500 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to pay her child’s tuition fees.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a businessman who sells second-hand shoes.  He has 12 years of experience in the business.  His business is located in Gikomba open-air market, which is well-known in Nairobi City.  He gives credit to Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to manage his business well.  He hopes to succeed in his business so as to employ more people in the future.  He has requested  20,000 KES to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Jane Rose

texts.en:
Jane is a 28-year old woman with one child, Safeway Wanja, age 3.

She has been running a tailoring business for five years. With anticipated profits from the growth of the business, Jane hopes to employ one person as staff, and improve on efficiency and timely delivery to customers. 

This is her first loan from KADET and she intends to buy a sewing machine.  In the future, Jane hopes to open a tailoring school and tailoring outlets in the city center.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Lass

texts.en:
Lass P., 55, is a low-income woman living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. To earn a living, Lass P. sells dried fish in the busy local market.  She also buys fresh fish and dries them and sells them to her regular customers. Her husband helps her in the same business. She  typically generates an income of US $3 each day to meet her family’s living expenses.

This couple has three children, one of whom is married and the other two single; both are employed in a garment factory. Lass P. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a US $1200 loan to be used to buy more fish to sell in order to add more profit and support her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nuris Esther

texts.es: Nuris T. de 59 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en Carrizal un barrio muy alegre y de gran tamaño de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es madre de 5 hijos y su actividad productiva  es la venta de pescado, actividad que inició porque el padre de sus hijos era pescador, le apoyó esa iniciativa en su momento y con ella pudo sacar a sus hijos adelante y sostener su hogar cuando el no estaba. Así es que Nuris diariamente sale con su ponchera en la cabeza a vender pescado en las calles de Barranquilla, tiene muchos clientes fijos a quienes les vende de contado, pero a otros  le da crédito, eso si a un plazo corto. Su negocio reporta utilidades de un 50 a un 70% de acuerdo  a la subienda del producto. Nuris durante 4 años ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ya tiene 7 financiamientos con este su credikiva, comprará pescado al pormayor, para venderlo a sus clientes que prepararán platos especiales en las épocas decembrinas. Nuris es una mujer feliz de la vida pues ella ha sido muy ahorradora, por eso gracias a su disciplina ha logrado aumentar los ingresos de su negocio y con ello adquirir su casa propia. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y convertirla en una saludable pescadería abierta al público todos los días del año.
texts.en:
Nuris T. is 59 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who lives in Carrizal, a very cheerful and large neighborhood of Barranquilla.  Nuris has 5 children and her business activity is selling fish.  She started this business because her children's father was a fisherman.  He used to support her in this initiative and, through her business, she managed to get her children ahead in life and support her household when he wasn't there.

Every day Nuris goes out with her bowl on her head to sell fish in the streets of Barranquilla.  She has a lot of regular customers who she sells her products to for cash but she provides her products to some other customers on short-term credit.  Nuris' business reports profits of 50-70% according to the season.

Nuris has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 4 years and she has had 7 loans if you count this Kiva loan.  She will use her loan to buy fish wholesale to sell to her customers who will make special dishes during the month of December.

Nuris is a woman who is happy with life since she has been a good saver.  For this reason, thanks to her discipline, she has managed to increase the profits of her business and use these to acquire her own home.  Her dream is to expand her business and turn it into a healthy fishmonger's shop which is open to the public every day of the year.

loans.use: To buy fresh-water and salt-water fish wholesale

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, reside en San Miguel, tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tostadas, vive con su esposo y una hija de 16 años de edad, este negocio fue fundado junto con su esposo desde hace 10 años, el horario de vender es de 3:00pm a 7:00pm, todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para incrementar su negocio a través de la compran de quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, entre otros productos para hacer las pupusas ya que desea producir más para ofrecer a los clientes.
El objetivo de Milagro es mantenerse en el negocio por largo tiempo, ir aumentando sus ventas para sacar a delante a su hija y que en el futuro sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Milagro lives in San Miguel. She is 35 years old and she sells pupusas and tostadas. She lives with her husband and their 16-year old daughter. She started her business together with her husband 10 years ago. They sell from 3pm to 7pm every day of the week. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business with the purchase of ingredients, such as cheese, pork meats, corn, and other ingredients necessary to make pupusas. She wants to increase production in order to offer more to her clients.

Milagro's goal is to keep her business for the long run, to increase her sales and to support her daughter so that in the future she will have a professional career.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, pork meat, and corn.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel D. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old and married with two small children. To make a living, Maricel runs a general store selling both food and daily-use products. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Maricel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto con su primer crédito, financiado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, inició el negocio que hoy tiene “El Caminante” , donde se dedica a la preparación y  venta de arroz de lisa, comida típica Barranquillera a base de la lisa, un pez de mar, que desova en aguas salobres, como las desembocaduras de los ríos; así mismo vende buñuelos, empanadas, deditos y otras delicias, que prepara con su esposa y transporta en su triciclo, el cual adquirió con su primer crédito con la Fundación, organización con la que ha logrado crecer y poco a poco provisionarse de vitrinas, calderos y de un tanque para refrescos, donde transporta el delicioso y típico arroz de lisa. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos en la comunidad donde habita y  donde tiene un mercado cautivo,  pues ahí mismo se encuentra  ubicada una estación de buses y de motos que son sus principales clientes.  José Alberto inició este negocio hace dos años , después de haber cambiado de actividad, ya que  antes se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de calzado artesanal femenino, pero este negocio tenia un  proceso productivo  demorado y obtenía utilidades mínimas. Por eso cuando decidió vincularse a la Fundación,  aprovechó para cambiarse hacia algo que conocía y le resultaba mas rentable. Con los créditos ha logrado estabilizar su negocio   y  planea mas adelante comprar un enfriador para guardar especialmente el pescado y las carnes. Este, su Credikiva, es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará materias primas e insumos como arroz, carne, queso,  maíz, harina y azúcar al por mayor. Sus indicadores financieros muestran una rotación de cuentas pro cobrar de 1 día, su rotación de materias primas es de 2 días y la rentabilidad es del 27 %. Con la nueva inversión planea ganarse descuentos por la compra en mayor cantidad antes de que los precios que inician a principio de año se hagan efectivos
texts.en:
With his first loan, provided by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, José Alberto started his current business called "El Caminante".  He makes and sells 'arroz de lisa' (a rice and fish dish).  This dish is a typical Barranquillera dish and is made with 'lisa', a sea fish which lays its eggs in brackish water such as river mouths.  José Alberto also sells 'buñuelos' (a type of fritter), empanadas (stuffed pastries), 'deditos' (cheese fingers) and other delicacies that he prepares together with his wife and then transports on his three-wheeled vehicle which he acquired with his first loan from our foundation.  Thanks to our organization, José Alberto has managed to grow in his business and gradually fill his display case, his cooking pots and his soft drinks cooler.

José Alberto's main customers are neighbors in his own community where he has a captive market as he is located in a bus and mototaxi station and this is where his main customers are found.  José Alberto started this business two years ago after changing his business activity.  He used to hand-make and sell ladies' footwear but that business had a long production process and he made minimal profits.  For this reason, when he decided to join our foundation, he took advantage of the situation and changed his business to something which he knew and which was profitable.  Through his loans, he has managed to stabilize his business and he plans, in the future, to buy a cooler in which to keep his fish and meat.

This Kiva loan is José Alberto's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy supplies such as rice, meat, cheese, flour and sugar wholesale.  His financial indicators show his accounts receivable turnover period at 1 day, his raw material turnover period at 2 days and his profits at 27%.  With this new investment, he plans to earn discounts by purchasing his supplies in larger quantities before new prices go into effect at the beginning of the year.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, meat, cheese, corn, flour and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Mrosa

texts.es:
DESCRIPCION: La profesora Rosa de 40 años de edad, tiene una hija adolecente la cual estudia su tercer año de primaria,  labora como docente de  primaria en Colegio La Uniòn desde hace 6 años, es una persona que ha luchado para que su familia tenga las comodidades nesesarias para que estos vivan dignamente y no le falte nada ya que es una docente emprendedora y muy trabajadora.  

Solicita su primer  crèdito con el apoyo de Kiva  y lo invertira en  comprar materiales para poner el piso a su casa de habitaciòn ya que esto le permitirà mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que a su familia no le falte lo basico en el hogar
texts.en:
DESCRIPTION:  Teacher Rosa, 40, has an adolescent daughter who is in third grade.  Rosa has been employed as an Elementary School Teacher at La Unión School for the last 6 years.  She is a person who has fought so that her family has the necessary comforts to live properly and not lack anything.  She is an enterprising, hard working teacher.

She is asking for her first loan with Kiva help which she’ll invest in the purchase of building materials to install flooring in her house for this will make it possible for her to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Her greatest dream in life is that her family has all the basics at home.

loans.use: To install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Victorio Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "VICTORI0 " es uno grupo  nuevo D. la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Zulma quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta y preparación D. comida para eventos especiales, casada tiene 2 hijos, el destino del crédito será para el aumento D. su capital. Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Lisbeth quien es casada, tiene 3 hijos, su actividad económica es la  venta D. cosméticos y comida su crédito lo destinara para el aumento D. su capital  y la Secretaria es la Sra. Daniela es soltera quien se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, es una persona joven y activa y su el crédito lo destinara para aumento D. capital. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidos con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Victorio" is a group that is new to the institution; it is in its first loan cycle.  It is maD. up of responsible and hardworking people.  This bank includes the members described below.  Zulma is the president and leader of the group, she has a business preparing and selling meals for special events.  She is married with 2 children, and she will use this loan to increase her working capital.  Lisbeth, the treasurer, is married, has 3 children and has a business selling cosmetics and food.  She will use this loan to increase her working capital.  Daniela, the secretary, is single and has a business selling cosmetics.  She is an active young person, and will use the loan to increase her capital.  All of the members are responsible and hardworking people who are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Kaen

texts.en:
Mrs. Kaen is a married woman who was born in 1972, while her husband was born in 1970. They have three children, two of whom are employed in garment factories; their third child is currently studying in a local public school.

They are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land. On their land, they grow rice, some of which is sold for a profit, while the remaining portion is used to feed their family.

Her husband is also a construction worker. Unfortunately, her husband's construction work is far from their home. As a result, she is seeking a loan to add to her savings so that she can one day buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Ermis Del Carmen

texts.es: Ermis del Carmen A. vive en Soledad y es la propietaria del negocio “ Servivio de Peluquerìa Los Angeles” actividad a la que dedicò depues de aprenderla, por la necesidad de aportar ingresos a su hogar para apoyar la gestiòn de  su conyuge en beneficio de su familia en la cual existen 3 hijos en las edades de 8, 12 y 14 años. Ermis aprovechando su trabajo comunitario decidiò dedicarse a este emprendimiento pues no encontraba fuentes de empleo empresarial, pero ahora se siente muy contenta porque ha logrado con su autonomia generar ingresos para su familia y estar mas cerca de ellos. Ahora su sueño se concentra en terminar de construìr su vivienda apoyar una educaciòn de caliad para sus hijos y sobre todo hacer crecer su negocio para lograrlo. Con su credikiva que es su tercer crédito con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que està vinculada hace dos años, comprarà  champoo, ganchos, pinta uñas, limas y todo lo que requiere para realzar la belleza de sus clientes y continuar vendindoles imagen personal y profesional de acuerdo a su personalidad.
texts.en:
Ermis del Carmen A. lives in Soledad and is the owner of a hairdressing business called 'Servicio de Peluquería Los Angeles'.  She has been in her business since she learned the trade as she needed to make income for her household in order to support her husband and three children aged 8, 12 and 14.  Taking advantage of her community work, Ermis decided to undertake this venture as she wasn't able to find any other sources of work.  However, now she feels very happy because, through her independence, she has managed to make income for her family and also be closer to them.  Now her dreams are to finish building her home, to provide her children with a good-quality education and, above all, to grow her business in order to achieve this.

Ermis' Kiva loan is her third with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that she has been a client of for two years.  She will use her loan to buy shampoo, hairpins, nail polish, nail files and everything else she needs to highlight the beauty of her customers and continue selling them a personal and professional image to fit their personality.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hairpins, nail polish and nail files

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita O. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Mercedita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap & rice per kilogram in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & instant noodles. This  will be the 12th loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & instant noodles.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum N., 50, is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since 2002. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland. They also harvest and sell their mature produce around three months after they began planting. From this business, they can generate an income of around $2 USD a day. This humble couple has five single children and one married child. Currently, Pum N. hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to insufficient funds, she has decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to begin a new farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to begin a new farming business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la Provincia de Quispicanchis, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gloria, la socia  tiene 25 años de3 edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos la socia trabaja desde hace 8 años vendiendo artesanía específicamente bisutería en la plaza central, a la socia también elabora tejas en piñipampa, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar artesanía al por mayor y abastecerse para la temporada alta en el sector turismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertiré n la compra de artesanía para la venta.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas" ("The Entrepreneurs of Andahuaylillas") communal bank is situated in the village of Andahuaylillas, which belongs to Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Gloria. She is 25 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children, She has been working for eight years selling artisanal crafts, especially jewelery, in the central plaza. Gloria also knits in the area of Piñipampa, She is requesting this loan to buy crafts wholesale and to stock up for the tourist high-season. She will use this loan to buy artisanal crafts to sell.

Gloria is grateful and wishes to convey that she will be disciplined in her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 42  años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 15, 5 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades  del hogar con un pequeño negocio que ella misma puso, la socia es docente de profesión pero este año no la contrataron y ella decidió elaborar tortas para la venta y en casa acondiciono un espacio para dedicarse a la elaboración de tortas, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos para la elaboración de tortas.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "PEROLNIYOC" and lives in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 42 years and married with three children, ages 21, 15 and 5.  She alternates her daily activities as a homemaker with a small business she set up.  She is a teacher by profession but was not hired this year so decided to make and sell cakes.  She adapted her house to include a working area and now is requesting a loan to buy materials and ingredients to make the cakes.

She is grateful for the loan which will help her improve her quality of life, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "MUJERES DE ÉXITO 1" y se ubica en el Estado de México. Este estado se distingue por su gente trabajadora, por sus lindas cascadas, los ojos de agua y por su ganadería. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y esta es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo. Dora es la presidenta del grupo. Inició su negocio hace 3 años de paletas de hielo y fresas con crema, día con día ella y su esposo salen a vender a distintos lugares de la comunidad, requiere este prestamo para comprar más materia prima como agua, fruta, palitos de paleta, fresas, crema etc. para elaborar sus productos. Ella tiene 28 años, estudió el bachillerato, es una persona emprendedora con muchas ganas de superarse, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es casada, tiene un hijo de 5 años y un hija de 2 años. Con las ganancias que obtenga las utilizará para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called "MUJERES DE ÉXITO 1" and is located in the State of México.  This state stands out because of its hard-working people, beautiful waterfalls, cloudbursts and livetock.  The group is comprised of 10 members who are requesting a loan for the first time.  

Dora is the president of the group.  Three years ago she began her business selling fruit popsiscles and strawberries with cream.  Everyday she and her husband go to different places in the community to sell their products.  She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as water, fruit, popsicle sticks, strawberries and cream, etc. to make her products.

She is 28 and has a high-school education.  She is an enterprising person with a strong will to get ahead.  Her greatest desire is to give her family the best she can.  She is married and has a 5-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter.  The income earned from her work will be invested in her business and used for her childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as water, fruit, popsicle sticks, strawberries and cream.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This lady is a 35-year-old businesswoman.  She is married to a shipping officer, and she has one child who lives with because she is her relative and also helps her with her business. In 2003, she established her provisions and drinks business. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

She requires a loan in order to add more drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, cheese, margarine, sardines, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She is very determined to improve her business. In future she plans to also sell rice as she is very close to the main market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, cheese, margarine, sardines, etc. for her business inventory.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old, married and has one child who is one year old. Christine sells milk at the market. Her business is well-organized and she works from 6am until 10pm every day. She has one year's experience.
Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a large quantity of milk. With her profits, Christine will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk.

loans.name: Trancito Zoraida

texts.es:
Transito Zoraida tiene 46 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla son 12 miembros se en su mayoría dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz, actividad mas antigua.


Transito Zoraida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial PRONACA y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es tener dinero para seguir inviertiendo en la agricultura.

Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Transito Zoraida is 46 years old, married and living with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank are located in the hamlet of San Luis de Zapotal that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It has 12 members who for the most part work farming corn and rice, a very ancient activity.

Transito Zoraida is a corn and rice farmer.  She buys her products at the Pronaca supply center and sells them at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She asks for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy supplies and fertilizer.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like illnesses of her laborers and the lack of money to reinvest.  Her dream is to have money to continue investing in farming.

She likes to work and to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nsenyi Women Group

texts.en: Suma is a forty five year old married woman with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She looks after the family with the help of her husband who is a fisherman. Their dream is to educate thier children. For three years she has been trading in fish. She started her business with 200,000 shillings and now she has 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is debtors who delay payment. Her vision to buy a refregerting van plus educating her children. Suma needs the loan to buy fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She has been raising pigs for five years. She was previously selling cosmetics to earn a living. Through her hardship and patience she has learned how to manage her business. This has helped her to retain her business for five years.

She hopes to have more pigs in her farm in the future. She has requested P 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future she hopes to have better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 50 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, vive en compañía de su esposa y 4 hijos de los 5 que tienen, en una casa que es propia. El trabajo de Cesar consiste en salir temprano de su casa en busca de clientes, a quienes ofrece helados en un triciclo que posee. Es así como recorre las diversas calles de su localidad, ofreciendo este producto, pues por vivir en una zona selva hay mucha demanda de refrescos y helados. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, por0que tiene tiempo para estar en su casa y poder administrar su horario. En adelante desea comprar un vehículo, para así vender helados y en menor tiempo recorrer las calles en busca de clientes. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se reintegró a su grupo después de un ciclo, pues por enfermedad se tuvo que alejar para no fallar a su grupo con las cuotas. Él está muy agradecido de contar con la ayuda de MFP ya que gracias a la institución dice pudo construir su casa por que siempre creyeron en él y siempre le dieron la oportunidad de poder crecer. Con el monto solicitado, comprará helados para abastecer su negocio, y así trabajar doble turno.
texts.en: Cesar is 50. He is a very hard-working and enterprising man who lives with his wife and 4 of their 5 children in their own home. Cesar goes out early to look for customers, to whom he offers ice cream from his tricycle. He cycles through the various streets in his neighbourhood, offering this product. Because they live in a tropical area there is a great demand for drinks and ice creams. He greatly enjoys what he does, because he has time to be at home and he can control his schedule. In the future he wants to buy a vehicle for selling ice cream, in order to get around more quickly in search of customers. He is very grateful to be able to count on MFP's help, as he says that thanks to the institution he has been able to build his home because they always believed in him and always gave him the opportunity to grow. With the requested loan, he will purchase ice cream to stock his business, and thus double his work.

loans.use: to buy ice cream.

loans.name: Eustacia

texts.es:
Eustacia D. 51 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento D. Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Eustacia desD. hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (aves y cerdos), su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500 nuevos soles para la compra D. más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Eustacia es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad D. que logren su objetivo.
texts.en:
51-year-old Eustacia lives with her husband and children in her own home which has basic services of water and electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Lambayeque department.  The people in this area work in farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Eustacia has been raising and selling farmyard animals (birds and pigs) for some years.  Her pens are located behind her home.  They are suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals balanced feed so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area, making good profits with which to cover her personal expenses.

Eustacia has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  She will use the profits that she makes from the sale of her animals to repay her loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Eustacia is a woman who, through hard work and commitment, has known how to get her family ahead in life.  Her aim has been for them to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Melgin

texts.en: Melgin is 23-year-old man who breeds pigs. He has 10 years of experience in this field. Melgin usually buys piglet and then raises and fattens them and resells them for a profitable price in the market town. He sells pig for meat. He is single. He would like to purchase more livestock for the future. For this purpose he applied of 17,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins of his pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, 4 of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. 

Rose operates a retail shop on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. Her other source of income is tailoring. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house. The family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Lorna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: La Gran Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Juliane is one of the members of the group named La Gran Esperanza "The Big Hope" 3. They sell mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country. It is one of the poorest communities, where the majority of the inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic with the goal of improving the quality of their lives.

Juliane has a grocery stand which she operates from her house. It is a modest home that she shares with her 4 children and her long-term partner. Juliane has been living in the country for several years, ever since she emigrated to the Dominica. She is currently in receipt of her 8th loan with Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner).  She has managed to repay and invest her previous loans to expand and increase her business.

Juliane plans on investing this loan in the purchase of snacks, juice, cookies, sweets, and other appetizers. One of her dreams is to buy or build a house. She plans to save her business benefits to make this dream come true. Juliane is thankful to all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juice, cookies, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. His income is very important as he is a big support for his father. He works as a freelance plumber, specializing in installing toilets, faucets, etc. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 4 years. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing materials for his projects. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. In the future, he plans to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: buy plumbing materials

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr:
Kokoé est une femme  âgé(e) de 51 ans. Elle est mariée å un coursier. Elle a 02 enfants.
Kokoé travaille comme revendeuse de miel, savons, des sacs en plastiques depuis 2001. Elle vend seule à ses clients dans sa maison  et achéte au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Kokoé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons de détergent, du miel et divers.
 Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit aider son mari dans les charges du foyer et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokoé is a 51-year-old woman and mother of two who is married to a courier. Kokoé has been selling honey, soap, and plastic bags since 2001. She works alone from her own home, selling merchandise purchased at the Grand Market of Lomé. 

Kokoé is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy boxes of detergent, some honey, and miscellaneous other items. She plans to use the profits to help her husband with the household responsibilities and ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to buy boxes of detergent, honey, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa para niños como polos,chompas,pantalones y medias, y tambien la socia tiene un pequeño restuarnta donde prepara almuerzos y cenas,por medios de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa y mejorar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,polos y chompas y tambien para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollos y carnes al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina continues with her business of selling children's clothes such as polo shirts, sweaters, pants and thights, she also has a small restaurant where she makes lunch and dinner, through these two businesses she gets her children ahead, our associate wants to expand and improve both businesses.  She requests a loan to buy pants, polo shirts, sweaters and wholesale ingredients to cook with such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the necessary loan payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, polo shirts, sweaters and wholesale ingredients to cook with such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Cupertina

texts.es:
Doña Cupertina  es  una señora Indígena humilde llena de sueños para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
Se dedica a la venta de  pozole y a la venta de carne y pan, lo que más le gusta es hacer pozole y vender pan ya que  es lo que más se vende.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Adrián  quien la apoya  y le ayuda en sus negocios  para que  no se canse tanto.
Tambien le ayuda a la señora Sonia a la elaboracion de pan para tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Pidio el prestamo para comprar maiz,aceite y cebolla para la elaboracion de pozole.
Tiene  una hija Aidé quien la ayuda en la venta de pozole.
Doña Cupertina está embarazada tiene  siete meses de embarazada está muy contenta ya que con el apoyo de fundación tiene herramientas para darle un mejor futuro.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar  y ayudar a su familia  para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Cupertina is a humble Indian woman full of dreams to get ahead and achieve her dreams.

She sells pozole, meat, and bread for a living.  She most enjoys making pozole and selling bread because those are what sell the most. 

She is happily married to Adrián, who supports her and helps her with her business so that she doesn't get too tired.

She asked for this loan to buy corn, oil, and onions to make pozole.

She has a daughter, Aidé, who helps her sell her pozole.

Cupertina is seven months pregnant and she is very happy because, with the support of the Foundation, she has the tools to giver her child a better future.

She thanks the Foundation for helping her and her family have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pozole

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Diana has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Yolanda is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Yolanda has been in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. Nora used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Her business has grown and become successful.

Now she's taking a new loan to pay for services to increase crop yield. This new loan will be used in her other type of business. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow up her business.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business of retail Shop

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is an IDP from the Armenian occupied Fizuli region. Now her and her family resides in the Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan  of $500. She bought a milking cow and started selling milk and milk products. Now she wants to have two more cows to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy two new cows

loans.name: Hussnia

texts.en:
Hussnia A. lives with four members of her family in District 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.
She is an uneducated women. Due to family problems, she took a loan for her brother who sells shoes at a  shop near the market. She says that this loan will be very profitable for her brother because he wants to expand his business.  She thanks AFS for helping  poor people.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en: R. Bahadur is is 45 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He became Chief of his own farm in 1996 when he purchased one milk cow. To cover his family expenses, Bahadur wants to purchase one more milk cow and sell milk to local people and buy one more calf. For this purpose his application has been approved by Aqroinvest for a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: Purchase of one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 27 years old, single, and is the owner of a photography business located in the center of the city, close to the Basilica de Caacupe, where every year crowds of faithful paraguayans gather from all over the country.

He has had this business for more than 12 years, and says that inicially he started to help his uncle, but once he felt sure professionally he decided to rent a studio, and with the initial loans obtained bought the necessary accessories to run his own business. Today he a solid client base and is associated with a group of people involved in event decoration, who inform him about festivals, birthdays, so he can present his proposals and gain more clients.

The world of photography is very competitive and requires one to be very dynamic and creative, because today clients are very demanding. Carlos is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a DVD burner, so that he can produce his work in DVD format.

Carlos tiene 27 años, es soltero, es dueño de una casa fotográfica, la misma está ubicada en el centro mismo de la ciudad, cerca de la Basílica de Caacupé, donde cada año se conglomeran un montón de fieles paraguayos de diferentes partes del país. Este oficio lo desarrolla ya hace mas de 12 años, comenta que inicialmente empezó siendo ayudante de su tío, y una vez que el se sintió seguro profesionalmente decidió alquilar un salón y con los primeros préstamos obtenidos fue comprando los elementos y accesorios necesarios para su independencia laboral. Hoy día ya tiene formado su clientela y se asoció con un grupo de decoradoras de fiestas quienes le facilitan las informaciones referentes a eventos, acontecimientos, cumpleaños, festivales, etc. para presentar sus presupuestos y de esta forma adquiere clientes. El mundo de la fotografía es un rubro muy competitivo y se requiere ser muy dinámico, creativo, ya que los clientes hoy en día son muy exigentes. Desea el crédito de $ 600 para comprar un reproductor de Dvd para poder realizar sus trabajos de filmaciones en formato Dvd.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in a DVD burner

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
MARIA GUADALUPE is 23 years old, she has 3 children, and she buys bread form different bakeries to resell it to people that live on her same neighborhood. She belongs to the group Santiago 1 along with Mrs. Imelda López López (fruit and vegetables sales) and Mrs. Ausencia López Lagunas (buys and sells fabrics by the meter). With the loan, Maria Guadalupe and Imelda will adapt a part of their houses to enable them to sell their merchandise there and Ausencia will invest the money in buying fabric rolls to enable her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA GUADALUPE, tiene 23 años, 3 hijos ella se dedica a comprar pan en grandes panaderías y revenderlo después entre las personas de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Santiago 1 junto con doña Imelda López López (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Ausencia López Lagunas (compra y vende telas por metros ). Con el préstamo Maria Guadalupe e Imelda adaptaran un lugar en sus casas para poder vender ahí sus mercaderías y Ausencia invertirá comprando telas por rollos para poder Aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: BREAD SALES

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr:
Komlavi A. was born in 1966 in Boko (Vo Prefecture). In his home in Kpémé, he takes care of three others. He is mastering his trade as a mechanic. In addition to this work, which brings in little money these days, he also drives taxi-trucks delivering gravel and beach sand to customers. This is his other business that allows him make up for the lack of income from his main work. As an energetic and enterprising man, he wants to rise toward independence for himself. Having acquired a used broken-down truck, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motor for it. With his own truck, he would fully be able to enjoy his new business, which will bring in more income to cover household costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komlavi est né en 1966 à Boko (P/Vo). Domicilié à Kpémé, il vit avec trois (3) personnes à sa charge. Mécanicien, il maîtrise son métier. En plus de sa profession qui est peu rentable en ces temps ci, Monsieur A. conduit des camions taxi pour livrer du sable de mer et du gravier aux clients. Cette seconde activité lui permet de compenser le manque de revenu de sa principale activité. Dynamique et entreprenant, il veut sortir de la dépendance. Ayant acquérir un camion d’occasion en mauvais état, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter un moteur neuf afin d’avoir son propre camion qui lui permettra de jouir pleinement de sa nouvelle activité, qui de ce fait va lui procurer plus de revenus pour la couverture des charges du foyer.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his truck

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Rustam I., who is 29, is married and has 1 child. Rustam is in the business of selling VHS and DVDs in the market "Sabrina" in the town of Yavan. Also, Rustam edits videos of weddings and other various events recorded on VHS. Using the loan, he plans to purchase blank DVDs, VCR, DVR, and other necessary equipment. This credit will give people living in the town an opportunity to obtain edited videos of celebrations and other events. Rustam is panning to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Ибодов Рустам, возраст – 29 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Рустам занимается продажей видеокассет и DVD – дисков в торговом центре под названием «Сабрина» в городе Явана. Также Рустам занимается видеомонтажем дней рождений, свадебных торжеств и других мероприятий записанных на видеокассеты. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести DVD-диски, видеомагнитофон и другое оборудование необходимое для этой деятельности. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям данного района производить видеомонтаж снятых на видео торжественных мероприятий. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for video editing and recording on CDs

loans.name: Cludina

texts.es:
Ms. Claudina belongs to the "Women with a Future" communal bank, located in the AA. HH. Pedro Portillo Mz M Lt 3, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 58 years old, is separated and is the mother of 3 children. One of those is an adult and two still depend on her. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of regional fruits.

She currently sells fruits on the porch of her house. She normally wakes up at 6 am to go to the market and buy the fruit to sell it in the morning in her house and in the afternoons she goes to sell it in the street.

With the loan of S/. 1,000, which she will pay in 5 months, she will buy a larger quantity of fruit and the rest she will invest little by little.

Claudia says that Manuela Ramos is a big help to her because she is a good worker, enterprising and is always very punctual with her monthly payments. Also she feels very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. La señora Claudina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el AA. HH. Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 3, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años, es separada y madre de 3 hijos, uno de ellos es mayor de edad y dos dependen aún de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en venta de fruta regionales. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de frutas en la vereda de su casa, normalmente se levanta a las 6 a.m. para ir al mercado y comprar las frutas para venderlas en la mañana en su casa y por las tardes sale a vender en la calle. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de frutas, el resto lo ira invirtiendo poco a poco. Claudina manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para ella porque es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y siempre es muy puntual en el pago de sus mensualidades y además se siente muy agradecida.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
B. Farhod is 25 years old. He is married with two children.

Farhod is providing taxi services with his vehicle. He has been working as a taxi driver for two years. Farhod is a very diligent young man and tries to work to make his clients happy. So today Farhod plans to install a fuel supply system working on gas. This allows him to decrease the prices for his services, as gas costs less than petrol. With this purpose he requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 18 months. This is the first loan for Farhod, and he thanks all supporting him and promises not to let you down.

loans.use: Installation of system for using the gas as the fuel for the car instead of petrol.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells maize, cassava, and groundnut. She buys them in large quantities and then sells them to her costumers. She is married and has three children. Business is going well and she wishes to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more stock to meet the demand of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 22 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 4 and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 14, 29, and 31. Monica owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en:
Ishrat T., wife of Mr. T., lives in a small city of Pakistan named Chichawatni. She is a housewife. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Ishrat helps him in his business. She has applied for a loan for her grocery shop. She and her husband plan that if she gets the benefit of this loan, they will diversify the products and make the grocery shop into a full grocery store.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members: Azra B. wants a loan to buy a motor cycle; Sharifan B. wants a loan to buy fruits; Amiran B. wants a loan to buy a vegetable cart; Yasmeen B. wants a loan to buy cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To diversify their businesses on a large scale

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Gloria M. L. has had a business raising chickens and pigs for more than six years. She maintains the business at her house.

In addition to tending to and feeding her animals, she also knits traditional crafts in her spare time.

She currently has two children, and is expecting another shortly. Her husband is not in Guatemala and, thanks to her enterprise, her and her children have been able to get ahead.

The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and pigs, which she buys while still small, then sell them from her house and at the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria M. L. tiene un negocio de crianza de pollos y marranos desde hace mas de 6 años, este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ella además de alimentar y cuidar a los pollos y marranos, también hace tejidos típicos a mano en sus tiempos libres. Actualmente tiene 2 hijos y otro que nacerá próximamente. Su esposo no esta en Guatemala, y gracias a sus negocios ella ha salido adelante con sus hijos. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de mas pollos y marranos, los que compra pequeños, y después los vende en su casa y en el mercado de la localidad.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Women's Group

texts.en:
Isabirye N. is the leader of Bwavumpologoma women's group in Kayunga, Busaana. Busaana is a small trading centre, but despite its small size all the surrounding villages depend on it for shopping because the distance to Kayunga is too far and costly.

Isabirye has a retail shop that sells new clothes which include traditional busuuti, trousers, shirts, shorts, casual wear, children's wear, shoes, luggage and handbags, bells and many other accessories. She has had this business for four years and has been a member of her women's group for two years now, and since that time her business has improved greatly because she has been able to add so much stock. Her husband is a teacher in the neighboring school in the village and only helps her out on weekends, so in addition to the shop she manages her farm and they have seven children ranging from 15 to one year.

Isabirye, together with her group members, needs a loan to improve her business. Isabirye plans to buy more traditional busuuti for ladies, shoes and bags once she receives the loan.

loans.use: To buy more new shoes, bags and clothes including traditional busuuti for ladies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is from the Parcialidad de Calasaya – Mazocruz. She is 50 years old, and she studied until the 5th year of primary school. She lives with her partner, and is the mother of three children. She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n – Barrio Alianza.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz for about 8 years. With her first loan of /. 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to buy 1 box of tomatos, 1 box of apples, and 1 bag of carrots. She has spent 17 years selling fruits and vegetables. She also works selling alpaca meat that she delivers to the middlemen in the city of Tacna, with an average of 8 or 10 beheaded a week. Doña Ángela has always enjoyed her business, since she was 22 years old and beginning to sell food.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 8 head of alpaca in order to sell the meat and with the balance of S/. 200.00 nuevos soles she will invest in 1 box of tomatoes, 1 bag of carrots, and more.

She has always dreamed of raising better alpacas in order to have better earnings. Today she has her precious breed of alpacas.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela es natural de la Parcialidad de Calasaya – Mazocruz, tiene 50 años de edad, estudió quinto de primaria, es conviviente, madre de tres hijos, vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n – Barrio Alianza. Aproximadamente hace 08 años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar 01 caja de tomate , 01 caja de manzana, 01 saco de zanahoria, ella hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, también se dedica a la venta de carne de alpaca que entrega los viernes a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna, en un promedio de 08 a 10 degollados a la semana, a doña Ángela siempre le gustó hacer negocio, desde los 22 años de edad empezó a vender comida. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 08 cabezas de alpaca para su venta en carne y con el valor de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles invertirá en 01 caja de tomate ,01 saco de zanahoria y otros. Siempre soñó con criar alpacas mejoradas para tener mayores ganancias, hoy en día tiene su precio las alpacas de raza.

loans.use: To buy livestock (alpaca).  To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en: Chhouk S. is 54 years old and lives with one of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1995, she has been selling shoes in the market to earn a living and is able to make US$5 in profit each day. Previously, she and her husband, Chhu Peng, 55, sold handbags and other stuff, but they have now changed to selling shoes. They sell many kinds of shoes, both female and male. Chhouk would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to add to her shoe inventory. Chhouk told a loan officer that on average she spends US$60 on food, and US$15 on utilities. (Chhu Peng is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To add to her shoe inventory

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim lives in a small village near the Southern Lebanese city of Tyre. He is a 55-year-old man, married, with 4 children. Ibrahim owns a mini market and wants to expand his product offerings to better serve his clients. Ibrahim has asked for a loan of $500 to do so. This will be Ibrahim's first loan, but he is confident that this will be the beginning of a strong relationship, and is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase new products for his mini-market

loans.name: Cumplidas Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "CUMPLIDAS",  ESTÁN REPRENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA NANCY QUIEN PRESENTA NEXO CONSANGUÍNEO CON LA SEÑORA ANONIA ELLA SON HERMANAS PERO TIENEN INGRESOS DEPENDIENTES POR LO QUE NO PRESENTA MAYOR PROBLEMA EN EL GRUPO. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, COMO PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES, UNO ES PROPIETARIO D. UN INTERNET Y EL OTRO ES  COMERCIANTE. TODOS LOS SOCIOS SOLICITARON EL PRÉSTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS Y A INCREMENTAR LOS INSUMOS PARA LA VENTA. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA PERO ELLAS SABEN COMO MANEJAR EL MERCADO EL CUAL YA CONOCEN. LAS SOCIAS YA TRABAJARON CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ANTERIORMENTE POR LO QUE TIENE  EXPERIENCIA Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN LOS PAGOS.
texts.en:
The members of the "Accomplished Women" village bank are represented by Mrs. Nancy who is related by blood to Mrs. Anonia. They are sisters and their incomes depend on each other. The group members are involved in varoius economic activities such as cosmetics sales, grocery sales, food sales, etc. One member runs a small internet cafe and another is a local merchant. All the members requested the loan to invest in their businesses and increase their inventory of goods to sell. As in all commercial undertakings, there is competition and supply and demand, but these women know how to manage their local markets that they know well. These members worked on unified groups beforehand so they have experience and are very responsible in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their business operations

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
"If you grow because of someone, let someone grow because of you." This is the principle in life of Analyn C..

Analyn is a mother of two healthy children, Johan, eight, already a Grade II student, and Jovany, five, who is a pre-school student. She is married to Joie who works as a farmer. They live in Barangay Antagan 1st, Tumauini, Isabela.

Analyn is a teacher in their community. However, her monthly salary is not sufficient to meet the daily needs of their family and in supporting her husband's farming business due to the increased cost of farm inputs such as fertilizers.

With her desire to uplift their lives, Analyn is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325). This will be used to assist her husband in the latter's farming business. They will buy seeds, fertilizers and pay the wages of the workers.

Her dreams for her family include a progressive life and a good harvest every year. For herself, she aspires to always have a stable job so that she can help her husband in fulfilling their dreams which also include, of course, supporting the education of their children. They want their children to finish their studies and hopefully be employed and have decent jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay wages.

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es: Don Onofre es un pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven, ha logrado sustentar a su familia, todos sus hijos mayores estan casados, 2 habitan junto a el y ya esan en la escuela primaria cursando el 5to y 3er grado; solicita financiamiento para compra de 2 pie de cria (vaquillas) y fortalecer su inventario ganadero, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien lo acompaña en su finquita y le ayuda en la actividad productiva cuidando cerdos, gallinas, peliguey y atiende a su marido muy temprano para que este garantice el cuido de sus animales y la produccion de granos basicos y tuberculos para el autoconsumo y cierta parte para su comercializacion, su sueño es crecer con su inventario ganadero y asi lograr menores condiciones de vida familiar desde su pequeña unidad de produccion.
texts.en:
Mr. Onofre has been working on the agricultural field since a very young age. He's been able to support his family and his three grown children. All his children are married, two of his children live with him since they attend high school (3rd and 5th year, respectively).

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase cows and increase his cattle inventory. He is supported by his wife who works with him taking care of pigs, hens, and other animals. Some of these animals are for commercial uses. His dream is to increase his current inventory and that way improve his family's living standards.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows and other farm animals

loans.name: Giuliana Elisa

texts.es:
Con tan solo veintitrés años Giuliana maneja un negocio de ropa y calzado. Sintiendo la necesidad de generar un aporte económico para criar a su pequeño hijo hace dos años empezó a vender ropa y zapatos por medio de unas amigas. 

Hoy en día no solo vende ropa por su cuenta si no también es propietaria de una mototaxi la cual la alquila para quesea trabajada en dos turnos. Paralelo a sus dos negocios también trabaja en una fábrica de zapatos, no obstante esta ocupación  es rotativa.

Por ahora quiere mantenerse estable en su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, aunque asegura que le gustaría aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Only 23 years old, Giuliana manages a clothing and shoe business. She started two years ago selling clothing and shoes with a friend's help, as she felt the need to have an income in order to raise her young son. Now, not only is she self-employed selling clothes, she also owns a mototaxi which she rents out in two shifts. At the same time as she has these two businesses, she also works in a shoe factory, albeit periodically. For now she wants to maintain a stable business selling clothing and shoes, although she says that she would like to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Hala has owned a beauty salon for four years. She does hairdressing as well as other beauty care. She requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work and change the décor of her salon. This is her third cycle and she has always repaid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her salon as well as her financial situation. Hala is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients can be anybody. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for her work and change the décor of her salon

loans.name: Amina D.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Amina K., a 28-year-old, married woman from Mbeya. She has two children, who are 5 and 9 years old. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants, who are orphans.

Since 2004, Amina has been operating a clothing sales business. She purchases clothes at wholesale prices and then sells the clothes at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and she is assisted by two family members. Amina currently earns approximately $150 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Amina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana N. is 41 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are still in school. Some are in the senior high school, while others are still in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. Elmina is not only a fishing community but also one of the tourist attractions in the region.

Christiana works in order to support her husband financially. She is a hair dresser by profession. She owns a shop in her community where many women come to have their hair fixed. Christiana says she has a number of clients due to her skill, experience and good customer relations. She has been in business for over 25 years and has trained about 50 professionals. Currently, she is training four apprentices. She wants a loan to procure goods such as shampoo, lotion, artificial hair, etc. to expand her services and product offerings.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, cream, artificial hair, etc

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is for four borrowers and the group leader is Mr. S., age 27. S. makes his daily income by running a motor taxi. Besides his job, he also uses his motorbike to transport vegetables to the market for his wife to sell. He and his wife now live with their two children who are teenagers and attend school. The couple are sacrificing parents who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with an education.

Unfortunately, S. can't attract as many clients to take his service as before because his motorbike also needs to be repaired. Thus he would like a loan to add with his personal savings in order to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one.

The other three borrowers include: S., a local farmer requesting a loan to use as capital in the farming business; M., who sells fresh flowers in the market and applies for a loan as capital to begin selling groceries; and R., who is a cleaning staff member for a company and is seeking a loan to cultivate rice.

The borrowers are villagers living in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra D. is new to ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.). She joined the organization just recently. She is a 33 year-old woman and hails from the town of Pandan, Antique. She is married to Avaristo, a hired laborer. She is blessed with a daughter named Junelie, a 15 year-old high school student. The town of Pandan is located in the north-western most part of Antique Province, where mountain and beach resorts can be found.

Before, Petra was selling bariw (a plant that its leaves are used in making sleeping mat) around the village. That was a tiring and time consuming business. She started the general store with small capital and the stocks are located inside their house.

When she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc.), she proposed an amount of 5,000 pesos as her first loan cycle to pay for the bulk of stocks for her general store. She is looking forward to the day she will have enough capital for the construction of a stall for her general store.

Her greatest hope is she would be able to support the education of her child up to college.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Rosemire

texts.en:
“Patience is very important in running a business,” said Rosemire N., a 25-year-old charcoal vendor. She is married to Redentor who is a helper in San Miguel Corporation and they are already blessed with a baby boy who is now six weeks old.

Her mother convinced Rosemire to seek the support of Kiva lenders in maintaining her charcoal-vending business. She wants it to become a successful livelihood in the future in order to give her children a better living. They are living in a simple Barangay of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela. In the village, Rosemire simply pursues being a charcoal vendor. She retails the product at a higher price in order to assists her husband with their daily needs.

For her business to grow and become productive, Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as additional working capital to her charcoal-vending business.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Basilio Mateo

texts.es: El señor Basilio es originario de la aldea Vásquez del municipio de Totonicapan se encuentra a ocho Kilometros  de la ciudad su actividad principal es la talabarteria en la elaboracion de calzado para damas y caballeros dicha actividad lo aprendio de su querido padre cuando el tenia diez años, el comenta por ser varios hermanos no tuvieron es facilidad de seguir estudiando por lo tanto el solo termino la primaria al trasncurrir de los tiempos el desidio seguir estudiando, los fines de semana y para este año esta por finalizar la carrera de diversificado y la cual necesita de algunos fondos para realizar un seminario y poderse graduar.
texts.en:
Mr. Basilio is from the Vásquez village in the Totonicapan municipality. His main activity is a leather goods shop making footwear for men and women, which he learned from his father when he was 10 years old. Since he has many siblings, Basilio did not have the opportunity to continue his studies and for this reason he only finished primary school. As time passed he decided to return to his studies on weekends and this year he will finish his high school degree, for which he requests a loan to fulfill his seminar and graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education Expenses

loans.name: Dadja

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris le métier de la menuiserie, il a ouvert son propre atelier qu’il a appelé « DON DE DIEU ». Outre les commandes de ses clients, il fabrique des meubles qu’il expose pour attirer le regard des passants. Les matières nécessaires à son activité de menuiserie étant épuisées, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 08 planches, 10 chevrons  et divers. Ainsi il pourra satisfaire de manière convenable ses clients.
Il est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman teaches carpentry. He opened his own workshop call "Don de Dieu" (Given by God). In addition to order from his clients, he makes furniture which he shows to attract passersby. The materials he needs for his business are exhausted, so he is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 8 planks of wood, 10 rafters and a variety of other items. In this way he will be able to satisfy the needs of his clients. He is married and the father of one child. It's with the revenues from his business that he supports his family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks, rafters and a variety of other items

loans.name: Ricardo Esteban Emiliano

texts.es:
Ricardo es padre de familia, tiene 47 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 21, 16 y 12 años de edad en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo.
