Tiene un automovil que utiliza en el servicio de transporte a escolares desde hace un año y actualmente moviliza a 10 menores hacia sus respectivos centros de estudio.

Ricardo trata de mantener a su familia y pagar la educación de sus hijos trabajando en su vehículo, que es su única fuente de ingreso, pero este, debido a su constante uso, ha empezado a necesitar mantenimiento urgente.

Por este motivo, el está solicitando por primera vez un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de un nuevo juego de llantas para su vehículo y así poder seguir brindando sustento a su familia.

El es consciente de la responsabilidad que con lleva el trabajar en el transporte de menores de edad, los padres de los niños confían mucho en él.

Su sueño de Ricardo es ver a sus tres hijos convertidos en profesionales y tener la satisfacción de haberles brindado un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a family man. He’s 47 and lives in his parents’ house in the city of Chiclayo with his wife and their three children, aged 21, 16, and 12. For the past year he has used his car to provide a transportation service for school children, and currently he drives 10 children to their respective schools. Ricardo tries to support his family and pay for his kids’ education using his vehicle, which is his only source of income. As a result of its continual use, the car is starting to need urgent maintenance, which is why Ricardo is seeking his first loan, for 1100 soles. He plans to invest in new set of tires, so he can keep bringing in income for his family. Ricardo is aware of the responsibility that comes with transporting children, whose parents put a lot of trust in him. His dream is to see his three children become professionals, and to have the satisfaction of having given them a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a set of tires for his car

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: Rubén Antonio R. O. tiene 60 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Su negocio dio inicio hace 18 años, por lo que anteriormente él se dedicaba a conducir camiones, por lo que con el poco esfuerzo que logro realizar logro comprar un camión y así obtener sus propios clientes, el es un hombre muy luchador y le gusta trabajar de manera muy humilde. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mejoras a su camión y comprar ciertos repuestos que le hacen falta. Su mayor sueño es lograr que todos sus planes se lleven a cabo.
texts.en:
Rubén Antonio R. O. is 60 years old. He is a married man and is responsible for one son. He is involved in transportation services. His business began 18 years ago. Before this, he used to drive trucks. Eventually, with some effort, he was able to buy his own truck and built his own clientele. He is a hard worker. The credit that he is requesting is for working capital in order to improve the condition of his truck and also purchase some needed parts for it. His biggest dream is to achieve all his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bélia Goussivi Elénam

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans la vente de couches jetables pour bébés  ainsi que des bonneteries. Elle a débuté cette activité en 2006 au Grand Marché de Lomé. Cette activité génératrice de revenus lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle réalise de très bonnes affaires car sa boutique est la seule du coin vendant de telles couches. Elle veut combler son stock qui s’épuise en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 100 paquets de couches jetables de différentes qualités, des bonneteries de toute sorte. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.

loans.use: Achat de couches jetables et de bonneterie

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta sells ripe bananas and some vegetables in her village, twice a month. She also has a livestock business (hog-raising) as an added source of income to meet her family's daily needs.

Loreta is 56 years of age and married to Bartolome A., who is a farmer. They are blessed with 11 children: three of them are already married and eight children are still single. There are only five family members living at home, including the parents, because some of the children work as family helpers in other places to help earn money. Her family lives in the distant village of Casalatan Cauayan City, Isabela. The place is located in the forest region of Cauayan City.

Loreta is able to earn around 500 pesos net income with her biweekly sales. She would like a loan of 7,000 pesos for further improvement of her business. Loreta hopes that someday her simple business will become a big and stable business earning more income for her family.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander B. sells fridges, television set and amplifiers etc at Elmina.  Alexander has received senior high education.  He is married and has four children His wife is a trader. Alexander has been selling fridges and so on since 2003. He is responsible for paying of school fees and bills. His loan will be used to buy more fridges and amplifiers to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more fridges and amplifiers to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old married man. He has been working selling charcoal since 2006 to earn income to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Hussein is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a shop and buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos.
Luz se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y ganaderìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, plumón y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su negocio propio. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz has been a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli Community Bank for the past year. She lives in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. Ms. Luz is 36 years old and did not finish college. She lives with her common law husband and has 5 children. Luz sells crafts and livestock for a living. She would like the lenders to know that with the first loan she obtained from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 500 new soles, she bought supplies to make crafts. She has asked for another 500 new soles so that she can buy wool, down and flannel. She hopes to own her own business one day. Her favorite thing about Banco Comunal is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and flannel

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es: El Sr. Onofre F. es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya con buen histórico de pago, el mismo está domiciliado en el -km 7 Ciudad Nueva de Ciudad del Este, es casado padre de una hija de cuatro años el mismo se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de sillones de varios tipos: chicos, grandes, fijos, con resortes, ya cuenta con una clientela formada en la zona, dicho crédito va destinado a la compra de hierros y accesorios para sillones, se trata de una persona con una visión amplia de crecimiento, y con disponibilidad y voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Mr. Onofre F. is a returning client of the Paraguaya Foundation. He has a good loan repayment history. Onofre lives in Ciudad Nueva, about 7 km from Ciudad del Este. He's married and has a four-year-old daughter. He builds and sells various kinds of chairs: large, small, hard, cushioned, etc. Onofre already has a customer base in the area. He just needs this loan to purchase iron and some chair-making accessories. Onofre is a man with a vision for his growing business, who is both able and willing to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying furniture-making materials: iron, accessories, other components

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 37 years old, has businesses in rice farming, hog raising and a sari-sari (general) store. Her business is located in Norala, South Cotabato. To help finance her businesses, she applied for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since it provides the lowest interest rate as compared to her previous experience from others, which lessens her financing charge. This loan will enable her to buy groceries, feed and fertilizers.

loans.use: Groceries, feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Mrs. Len M. is 27 years old and she lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming she also raises pigs.

In order to support her farming and pig-raising, Mrs. Len M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to dig a well to support the field crop. The rest of the loan she would use to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Mrs. Len M.’s husband, Mr. Vuth Chom, is a soldier and he is also a motorbike taxi driver who is able to make a small income to support the family living. Mrs. Len M. is the mother of a child who is a student in the local primary school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, dig a well, and buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha P. S., es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de cristalería, productos derivados del plástico y productos de melanina. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la farmacia los ángeles 20vras abajo, quien junto con su hija atienden el negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y productos derivados del plástico, cristalería y ropa interior, que se vende mucho.

Es madre soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo, ninguna esta  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.


Lleva 25créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha P. S. is an enterprising woman who owns a business selling glassware and products made of plastic or melamine resin. She started with initial capital of 10,000 NIO and also acquired a loan ten years ago. Her business is located in the Israel Lewite Market, twenty yards from the main entrance of Los Ángeles Pharmacy. Martha and her daughter manage the business from 8am until 5pm. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy clothing, plastic products, glassware, and undergarments. She sells a lot of these products.

Martha is a single mother of two dependent children, but they are not of school age. Prior to owning a business, she worked as a housekeeper.

Martha has received 25 loans from CEPRODEL over the past five years. The proceeds were invested into her business, which has grown by diversifying her products so that she could complete in the marketplace. She is thankful for the financing provided by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, plastic products, glassware, and undergarments

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Mrs.Emeliana B. is a PDP-LP member. She is 47 years old, married with 5 children. She is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer. This supports their daily basic needs. She  has managed her business for almost 4 years and earns approx. 4,000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be able to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 7,000 from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business so that she could service more customers. Now she has a new loan of 10,000 from PMPC which will be used to improve her business. This is her 5th loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for her puto (rice cake) making business

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli R. is from the village of Pilpila, Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac. He is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Noli owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Noli has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Noli joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase equipment to improve his business. Noli is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia tiene 46 años y siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 41 años, quien trabaja como albañil, y con sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su comunidad se llama “Yurinaki”, allí se encuentra su negocio, ubicado en la plaza de la comunidad, donde vende gallinas, patos y gansos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Teodosia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más alimento para sus aves, ya que tienen que estar grandes y sanas.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 46 years old and has always worked very hard in order to excel in life. She lives in her own home with her husband Pedro, who is 41 years old and works as a bricklayer, and with her 3 dear children, who are the reason for all of her efforts. Her community is called "Yurinaki," and that is where her business is located, in the main square of the community, where she she sells chickens, ducks and geese, which are very well fed and cared for. It is for this reason that she has many customers and her income is good. What she likes most about her work is feeding the birds, since she raises them with much care. She has spent 5 years in this business and thinks the most difficult part is having to having to remain at her post all day, waiting for customers. In the future, she plans to rent a shop where she can offer her customers greater convenience. This is Teodosia's sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make payments on time and is committed to doing so. She is a very cheerful and responsible member of her communal bank. With the one thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy more food for her birds, since they must grow big and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her animals

loans.name: Chrisostom

texts.en:
Chrisostom O. is a retail shop owner in Nambale, Busia district. He started this business in 2009 as a project for income generation. He is 25 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. Chrisostom is a former supermarket attendant.
Chrisostom would like a loan of KES 20,000 to expand his retail shop inventory to spearhead his move into wholesaling. His future plan is to expand into a wholesale business that will cover the whole of Western Kenya.

loans.use: Expand Stock

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Caminando Con Jesus (Walking with Jesus), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, a large city known for its production of tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Ana makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Ana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business hawking clothing around her neighborhood by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to save towards her goals of putting her business in its own locale and purchasing a vehicle to move her merchandise, developments that will make her life a lot simpler. Ana thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with five children and four of her children go to school. The fifth one is still young.  Florence doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Florence owns a stall in Kalerwe selling tomatoes and onions. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions.  She has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for one and one half years, servicing her third loan. Besides this tomato business, she owns bicycles for hire. Florence sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale.  Florence works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are seasonality (when tomatoes are scarce and when it rains and her customer cannot reach her because she works in a muddy place). She aspires to buy her products directly from the farmers. Florence joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by acquiring more capital. Florence resides in and rents a one-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and  onions

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, D. 61 años,  es una madre muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene 5 hijos mayores, vive junto a su esposo, en su casa que es propia.DesD. hace 30 años, se dedica  al negocio D. desayunos, prepara distintos jugos (maca, quinua, soya), también ofrece golosinas y todo tipo D. sándwiches en general. Cuando tiene todo bien preparado, carga todo en su carrito, con el que se moviliza  fácilmente, y se ubica en la puerta D. un colegio, ubicado a 5 cuadras D. su casa. Sus compradores frecuentes, son los estudiantes  y algunas madres D. familia. Hace algunos años  atrás,  preparaba sola sus comestibles, desD. las 2 D. la madrugada, actualmente cuenta con la  ayuda D. su esposo y ya no madruga, pero venD. igual. Está muy satisfecha  por lo rentable D. este negocio, aunque por su avanzada edad  piensa retomar el negocio D. su bodega.Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su negocio, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su grupo D. trabajo, es la líder, por lo que es muy respetada.Herminia piensa en comprar algunos insumos que necesita para sus desayunos y algunas golosinas que también ofrece, pues quiere implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Herminia, 61 years old, is a hard-working and responsible mother of five grown children. She and her husband have their own home. For 30 years she has worked selling breakfast, different juices like maca (a Peruvian herb),quinoa, and soy, she also sells snacks and all kinds of sandwiches. When she has prepared everything she loads her cart, which helps her move around easily, and sets up outsiD. of the high school which is five blocks from her house. Her regular clients are the students and some parents. A few years ago she prepared all the food herself and had to wake up at two in the morning. Now her husband helps her and she does not have to wake up as early and still sells as much. She is happy because it is a profitable business, though because of her age she is thinking of restarting her mini-market business. This is the eighth loan she has received from MFP, and she knows that the loan will be very useful to help grow her business. She is committed to making her payments punctually. She is the leader of her work group and is very respected. Herminia plans to buy supplies that she needs for her breakfasts and some snacks that she also sells.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and snacks for her food stand

loans.name: Nantiebe

texts.en: Mr. Nantiebe K. is 34 years old and works in Lome, his hometown. He has a store called "Kisi Techno" where he sells electronics such as cellphones, laptops, irons, vacuums, and other goods. He's been in business since 2007. He's married to a cleaning woman and they have two children. He's in the process of taking his third loan from WAGES in order to purchase laptops and portable irons. He has requested 400,000 CFA.

loans.use: To purchase appliances like laptops and irons

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en: Madelina D. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials. Madelina is 30 years old and is married to a cattle farmer. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Madelina hopes to be able to open a bar and stock more crates of beer in the bar for the same business. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en:
Putu D. (0) is a 38-year-old male living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Putu is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Karya Murni Abadi (PK-00108).


Putu is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Putu owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  Putu has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Putu is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  He is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Putu D. (0) merupakan 38 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Karya Murni Abadi (PK-00108).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Putu menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Putu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Efua Maame

texts.en:
Efua Maame Y. sells rice, gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), bread, margarine, sugar and other items at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to educate her children.

Efua Maame has attained junior high level of education. She is married to an electrician and has three children. She is responsible by supporting her husband in taking care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce R. is forty four years old, single and has one child aged sixteen years old who she hopes will become a pilot some day. Her business is located at Tassia, a residential area in Nairobi. She has been selling house decor such as teddy bears and curtains to the local people for the last fifteen years. She has managed to employ thirty one people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is how to reduce fraud by the employees. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more items  too meet customer demand and to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business until its able to make Kes 5,000,000 as income. She describes herself as an aggressive business woman.

loans.use: To buy supplies of assorted goods including curtains and teddy bears.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a 37 year old Mpesa (mobile phone) operator in Changamwe Mombasa. She is a single lady who supports two of her siblings, back in her rural home. She has been in this business for the last two years and has a great income.

This, being her second loan in KADET LTD, she hopes to add more Mpesa float with the requested loan and further expand her mpesa business with the anticipated profit.

She hopes to open a hardware shop in the future and to pay her brothers’ school fees up to the University level.

loans.use: To add more Mpesa float (mobile phone) with the requested loan.

loans.name: Vyizigiro Group

texts.fr:
Odette N. est une commercante agee de 38 ans qui habite la commune urbaine de Kamenge en Mairie de Bujumbura.Elle fait le commerce de charbon de bois depuis 4 ans alors qu'elle faisait le commerce de vires avant.Elle est veuve.Elle arrive au 13  cycle dans le credit communautaire avec Turame.

Elle a un enfant unique age de 19 ans qui etudie en 9e annee des etudes secondaires.
Elle demande le credit Turame-Kiva pour augmenter la quantite de charbon de bois a commercialiser dans l'espoir de faire des epargnes.
Elle a toujours prefere le credit Turame par ses facilites d'obtention et de souplesse dans le remboursement contrairement aux autres institutions financieres de la place.

Elle fait partie du groupe communautaire "VYIZIGIRO"
texts.en:
Odette N. is a merchant, aged 38, who lives in the urban community of Kamenge in Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  She has been doing commerce in charcoal for four years, whereas she used to sell staple foods before.  Odette is a widow.  She has an only child, aged 19, who is in his ninth year of secondary studies.  

Odette has achieved her thirteenth community loan cycle with Turame.  She is asking for a Turname-Kiva loan in order to increase the amount of charcoal to sell in the hopes of saving some money.  She has always preferred Turname loans because they are easy to obtain and flexible in their repayment.  This is contrary to the other financial institutions in the area.  

Odette is part of the community group Vyizigiro.

loans.use: Increasing the amount of charcoal to market in the hopes of saving some money

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Merlinda B. operates a mini boutique with bartered goods from Zamboanga City as her main products. Together with her husband, she opened up a stall in one of the malls of the city. She is 35 years of age, married and blessed with one child. They are from the Barangay (village) of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She’s been in this kind of business for four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC in the Regular Loan program, she was given the privilege of applying for a loan. She is now requesting a first loan of 30,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her mini boutique business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially to meet their basic needs, to save for a future use and to pay for her child’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for a mini boutique business

loans.name: Good Sisters Group

texts.en:
Oniekeh F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Sisters. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 25 to 14. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a kind and hardworking woman. She cares for two siblings.

For 10 years, she has been selling palm oil and charcoal in Congo Town Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 LRD portion of this 39,000 LRD group loan to buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to improve her business to an international standard.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 61 year-old woman, married to Humphrey Mungai. Together they have seven children, ranging from ages 30 to 42. She has been in the business of dairy farming and she also rears pigs, for 40 years in the area of Kimuga, a rural area close to the capital city of Nairobi. She has sold milk to local dairies and produce to traders from the city.

Rahab was introduced to KADET by one of KADET's already existing clients. Using her loan, she intends to build a better and bigger pig sty in order to accommodate more pigs. 

In the future, she hopes to retire peacefully and to build a better house for herself and her family. She thanks the Kiva lenders who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To build a new pig sty

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
52-year-old Joana S. is a father of ten children with seven still attending school. He has been farming for thirty years in his hometown of Kisii in western Kenya. His produce of tea, bananas, milk and maize are sold locally. His farming challenges include prolonged drought and hailstorms.

Joana has applied for this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Joana hopes income from this investment will pay school fees for his children and uplift his family’s living standards in terms of food. He aspires to run a retail shop within the local market.

Joana is glad Juhudi offers these loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian E. sells charcoal in both small and large quantities in Abura. She is married and has eight dependents. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing, and educating her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban B.  and his wife, Mrs. Soeun Shun, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children. 

Ban and his wife are vegetable farmers. When he is not at the farm, he also works for a brick kiln. He is requsting a loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Espérence Augustine

texts.fr:
Femme de 46ans, célibataire, mère de 2 enfants,  coiffeuse depuis 2007. Son salon, situé dans sa zone d’habitation,Elle coiffe, maquille les femmes et les  jeunes filles de son quartier et les environs.

Le remboursement du prêt  n’as pas connu de défaut de payement grâce à ses ventes journalières qui  avoisinaient les 15.000F.

Avec le présent prêt, elle va plus améliorer les conditions de ventes en augmentant les articles de beautés comme : des  gros  pots de défrisant, 1 gros pot de gel a cheveux, 5litres de shampoing, 5litres de  démêlant, des gammes de produits de soins capillaire de grande marque, les filets, les produits pour maquillage et pour les grandes les  cérémonies. Les mèches et tissage de toutes marques.
 
Dans le souci de faire toujours mieux, elle veut agrandir son salon en ajoutant  les produits cosmétiques afin de faire plus de bénéfices et épargnes et enfin s’occuper convenablement de ses 2 filles.
texts.en:
This lady is a single 46 year-old mother of two, and has been a hairdresser since 2007.  From her salon, near her home, she offers makeovers for women and young girls in her quarter and its surroundings. 
She has repaid her previous loan thanks to her revenue that approaches 15,000 F per day. 
With the current loan, she wishes to improve her services by offering beauty products such as frizz serum, hair gel, five litres of shampoo, five litres of conditioner, a range of branded hair products, hairnets, makeup, and hair foils and weaves for special occasions. 
In order to continuously improve her service, she wishes to grow her salon by adding cosmetics to her product range; she hopes that in doing so she'll generate higher profits and will be able to put some money aside so she can look after her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as conditioner, gel, face cream and manicure / pedicure products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, es una joven madre de familia de 30 años de edad. Su familia lo conforman su esposo Javier y sus 3 hijos menores, a los que cuidan con mucha dedicación en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Su principal actividad económica se basa en la agricultura, a pesar de sus cortos 7 años de experiencia, sus cultivos de lechuga, arveja y maíz, son los mejores de la zona. “Lo primordial en el cuidado de los sembríos es el tiempo que dedicas a ellos”, asegura. Por ello en cada campaña agrícola sus cultivos ya tiene comprador, los comerciantes mayoristas visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para poder ver el crecimiento de sus sembríos, asimismo para trasportar la cosecha entera. Como  existen intermediarios en la comercialización, ella está juntando capital para poder comprar un camión, y de esa manera comercializar sus productos por su propia cuenta.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde es puntual y responsable con los pagos que realizan dentro de su asociación. Marcelina en el próximo mes, cosechará lechuga, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar semillas de arvejas, que esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas que dentro de muy poco cosechará.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a young mother, 30 years old.  Her family is made up of her husband, Javier, and their 3 young children, who they care for with much dedication in their own home, located in the village of Pongo. Her principal economic activity is agriculturally-based; in spite of her short 7 years of experience, her lettuce, pea and corn crops are the best in the region.  "It is paramount when taking care of the plantings to dedicate time to them", she says.  For that reason in each field her crops already have buyers.  The wholesalers visit her farm lands to see the growth of their plantings, and to take away the whole harvest.  Since she has to market through middlemen, she is getting together money to be able to buy a truck, so that she can market her own products herself. 

She is part of the village bank "Paraiso al progreso" and this is her third credit with MFP, where she is punctual and responsible with the payments they make to the association.  In the next month, Marcelina will harvest lettuce, so she is thinking of buying pea seeds to spread on the farmlands that she will harvest from soon.

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one of their children.

Leonor is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit and vegetables stall by purchasing different kind of fruit, beans, meat and vegetables. She also runs a "Fritura" - fried food stall, where she sells meat, plantains, etc. She will use the profits to save. She wants to have a better future, and she will save part of the profits long-term for that. Her most difficult challenge is to build her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, 27, is married with two children aged seven and two, the elder of whom is attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for four years, producing tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority, and milk, beans, and maize, which are sold locally. He earns 8,000 KES monthly from employment, as additional income for his farming business.

Justus has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He plans to use the extra income from the sale of the milk to pay school fees. He is also focusing on acquiring more land and increasing the number of dairy cows he keeps to four.

Justus notes that pests and diseases are a great impediment to his farming business. However, he appreciates the loan services provided by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en:
Sarn D. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. 

D. is a housewife, while her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $75 on food and US $30 on other necessary expenses. 

D. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase more construction supplies for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies to improve the business

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita L. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Manolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Manolita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and rice per kilogram in the local community. Manolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Manolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Manolita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and junk food. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Manolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and junk food for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of nine people. Mrs. Vanny is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purpose in order to improve their family’s standard of living.   

Mrs. Vanny was born in 1971. She is married to Mr. Thy. They are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice and sugar cane to support their own family and to sell. They are also chicken breeders. She faces a problem in the sugar cane field in that the soil is infertile. So, to improve her sugar cane production, Mrs. Vanny is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. 

She is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are construction workers and the other one is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su familia, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, tiene un negocio donde vende cosméticos y lociones, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como: cremas, lociones, esmaltes, maquillajes, entre otros que son necesarios para fortalecer el negocio.
Las aspiraciones de Rosa es que su negocio se mantenga, continuar con financiamientos para lograr establecerse.
texts.en:
Rosa resides in Chinameca in the Department of San Miguel, where she lives with her family. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 8. Rosa has a business selling cosmetics and lotions. She works Monday through Saturday.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy products such as crèmes, lotions, nail polishes, makeup, and other necessary items to strengthen her business. Her aspirations are to maintain her business and continue accessing loans so that she can keep it in operation.

loans.use: to purchase crèmes, lotions, nail polishes, makeup, and other items.

loans.name: Analffy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Analffy; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y también el socio trabaja como mecanico,el arregla motosierras,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el negocio de motosierras.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y algunos materiales para arreglar la motosierra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadores" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Analffy. He is 45 years old and is married and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his grocery store business. The member sells basic necessity products like rice, sugar, milk and noodles and also works as a mechanic. He fixes chainsaws. Through these businesses he gets his children ahead. The member wishes to expand and improve the grocery store and improve his chainsaw business. He is requesting the loan to purchase products for the shop and some materials to fix the chainsaw.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase products for his grocery store and some materials to fix his chainsaw.

loans.name: Charlotte Esi

texts.en: In this picture is Charlotte. She is divorced and has four children. She attended a vocational school. She cooks wakye and sells it at Abura. (Wakye is a combination of rice and beans). It is normally served with hot black pepper sauce, macaroni, salad and eggs. Charlotte wishes to expand her business and needs a loan to buy additional beans, rice, eggs, vegetables and others to cook wakye. The profit she hopes to get as a result of the loan will be used to educate her children. She is standing close to the bag of beans she uses for the wakye.

loans.use: to buy additional beans, rice, eggs, vegetables and other items to cook wakye to sell

loans.name: Virgnie

texts.en: Virgnie, 48 years old, has five children ranging in age from 18-28 years old. Her husband doesn’t work. Virginie has been selling green bananas on a wholesale basis for 15 years, thus enabling her to pay for her children's school fees and their medical insurance. She is now requesting a loan to buy more green bananas to sell, and will use the additional profits to help expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina D. 53 años D. edad, vive con tres hijas en una pequeña casita que logró adquirir gracias a muchos esfuerzos.  Evangelina es una mujer luchadora que con su trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus hijas las cuales se encuentran trabajando ya que no lograron sacar sus estudios debido a la situación económica. Esta mujer sueña con ver a su familia en mejores condiciones  y piD. a Dios que le D. la fuerzas necesarias para poder seguir ayudándolas en lo que pueda. Una gran mujer, valiente y emprendedora, se dedica  a la venta D. verduras en la zona donD. resiD., tiene un puesto en el que ofrece todo tipo D. verduras como: zanahorias, papas, repollos, chile verD., entre otros. Sus productos son muy demandados ya que siempre trata la manera D. mantener productos frescos y sobre todo atender a sus clientes D. la mejor manera. Es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para poder abastecer su pequeño negocio D. variedad D. verduras como: zanahorias, papas, yuca, güisquiles, chiles, tomates, etc.  y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad D. verduras y lograr obtener mayores ventas que le permitan sostenerse económicamente y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 53, lives with three daughters in a little house that she acquired thanks to much effort.  Evangelina is a tenacious woman who has managed to raise her daughters who are working because economic conditions maD. it impossible for them to stay in school.  

This woman dreams with seeing her family in better conditions and asks God to give her the necessary strength to continue helping them in any way possible.  A great, brave, enterprising woman, she sells vegetables near where she lives.  She has a stand where she offers all kinds of vegetables like: carrots, potatoes, cabbage and green chilies, among others.  Her products are in high demand because she always tries to keep them fresh and, above all, treat her customers the best way possible.

Because of this she is asking INTEGRAL for this loan to be able to stock her small business with a variety of vegetables like: carrots, potatoes, manioc, chayote, chilies, tomatoes, etc. to offer a wider variety of vegetables and obtain more sales that will make it possible for her to support herself and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy carrots, potatoes, manioc, chayote, chilies, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Marliz Viviana

texts.es:
Marliz Viviana tiene 23 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla son 12 miembros se en su mayoría dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz, actividad mas antigua.

Marliz Viviana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial PRONACA y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz,  compra de semilla, abonos y remedios para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es tener mejor nivel de vida.


Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Marliz Viviana, 23, is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank are located in the hamlet of San Luis de Zapotal that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It has 12 members most of which work farming corn and rice, an ancient activity.

Marliz Viviana is a corn and rice farmer.  She makes her purchases at Pronaca supply center and her sales take place at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy seeds, manure and crop remedies.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  She faces difficulties like illnesses of her field hands and the lack of money to reinvest.  Her dream is to have a better standard of living.

She likes to play sports and work in the fields.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manur and crop remedies.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 7 Group

texts.en: Lisa lives in the town of Cilincing with her husband and two children. For the last two years, she and her husband have made a living by running a retail shop located in front of their house where they sell food items such as groundnuts and peas. She is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to buy more of these items to sell to their customers. Her goal is to expand her business and earn enough money to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn lives in the Philippines. She is is 21 years old and single with 1 child. 
Jovelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & detergent. She has been running this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for sale at her store.
Jovelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for her store.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is 46, married and has four school-age children. He aimed to improve their source of living to be able to continue sending his four children to school. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years planting rice and some vegetables in their village. Since it is the main source of their income, he aimed to increase his production to satisfy their basic necessities. 

Having inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost for transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase his yields and income to satisfy all his family needs. He believes that a man who has strong faith and determination will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost for transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 28 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Allí se dedica a alquilar lavadoras y a la venta de productos de belleza;  negocio que inició hace 3 años cuando compró su primer lavadora y ahora ya ha logrado un número de 4. Jorge y su esposa trabajan juntos, porque tienen metas comunes con tal de lograr que en el futuro,  su hijo sea una persona exitosa. Su mercado a nivel de los dos negocios lo conforman amas de casa, empleados, vecinos, referenciados de su barrio y de comunidades aledañas. Su idea emprendedora empezó desde su observación pues sus vecinos lavaban con máquinas alquiladas desde otros barrios lejanos, por eso cuando emprendió su propia aventura de negocios,  inició con mayor probabilidad de dar resultados. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo, pues se torna insuficiente para la demanda del servicio y sobre todo para el aumento de sus ingresos,  como el y su esposa lo sueñan. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hacen a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprarán 3 lavadoras mas y una carreta para transportarlas. Mientras esto ocurre continúan manejando un margen de contribución del 47%, una rentabilidad neta del 39,9% y un endeudamiento actual de 0, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos su crecimiento y éxito en su inversión.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and one-year-old son. He rents out washing machines and sells beauty products. Jorge started his business three years ago when he purchased his first washing machine and now he has four of them. He and his wife work together because they have common goals that they want to accomplish in the future, such as seeing their son become a successful person. His target market for both businesses consists of housewives, employees, neighbors, and referrals from his neighborhood and the surrounding communities. His entrepreneurial idea began when he noticed that neighbors were doing laundry with machines that they rented from other neighborhoods that were quite distant. For this reason, he started his own business with a high probability of achieving results. At the moment, his greatest challenge is having enough operating capital to meet the demand for his service so that he and his wife can fulfill their dream of earning more income.

For this reason Jorge is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy three more washing machines and a cart for transporting them. In the meantime, he continues to manage a contribution margin of 47%, net profitability of 39.9%, a current debt ratio of 0. These financial indicators signal an increase in growth and a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase three washing machines and a cart for transporting them.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 55 years old. She is a mixed-crop farmer and is married to Erastus, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 25 and 23. She has been a farmer for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Lucy is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig keeping. Her hope is to keep pigs for a large amount, which will help increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 52-years-old and has been in the farming business for 25 years in his home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is married with four children, all adults save for the last born. He employs two farmhands and produces coffee,milk and peas which he sells to the local market. He is an employee of the government working as a veterinary officer.

Silas has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a dairy cow. He says the income will enable him educate his child and expand his farming business. He is optimistic about the dairy business and reiterates it will grow owing to his experience as a veterinary officer. He aspires to own at least five dairy cows

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget, 33, is a farmer who resides in Kompot province, a good agricultural zone. She has a life partner in her husband, Mr. Hy, who works as a fisherman. Her husband regularly catches fish, crabs and other sea animals from the sea nearby and then brings them to sell in a market. Together, they normally earn an average of $4USD each day to cover all the expenses. They are blessed with three young children who are attending a local public school.
Mrs. Nget is seeking a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a motorcycle for the use of the family. This loan will help facilitate her family's comfortable living and reduce some expenses on transportation fees.
In the future, Mrs. Nget hopes she’ll be able to expand her family’s business and to support all her children to the university level in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the premises such as buying a refrigerator and to supply her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene la edad  de  52 años, vive con su esposa y  una hija actualmente que son su prioridad. El con el crédito quiere comprar los insumos y la semilla para sembrar frijol. El cuenta con un lote actualmente desocupado y es de optimas condiciones para la agricultura por lo cual quiere realizar esta siembra. El quiere darle un buen uso al terreno y ponerlo a cosechar en las mejores condiciones posibles para así obtener el máximo de producción del frijol sembrado. El pretende con el crédito generar una excelente asistencia a la siembra y así obtener una gran cosecha generando el máximo de ganancias económicas para el bienestar de su familia y su estabilidad económica.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jorge, 52, lives with his wife and a daughter who are his priority.  He wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies and seeds to plant beans.  He has a fallow field that’s in optimum condition for farming and this is why he wants to plant.  He wants to put the field to good use and start it producing in the best possible conditions so that he will obtain the best possible bean harvest.  He plans to use the loan to provide excellent assistance to the crop so that the maximum possible profits will be generated from it for his family’s wellbeing and economic stability. This is his first FUDECOSUR loan. He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She sells Cambodian noodles. Her husband is a soldier. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, she can save on transportation costs. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina vive en la zona del tercer anillo,  la vivienda es familiar actualmente vive con sus hijas, su esposo se encuentra en el Brasil por motivos de trabajo,  la cliente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chinelas bordadas ella las borda a mano es un trabajo muy delicado ya que utiliza pedrería muy pequeña, también lentejuelas y adicionalmente elabora manillas y llaveros, también bordados a mano, los cuales son comercializados en la feria de barrio lindo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, los días sábados, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de materiales para la fabricación de manillas y bordados de chinelas, compra de hilos, ya que estas fiestas de fin de año tiene mucha venta y de esta manera mejorar mas sus ingresos, la Sra. Cristina es un artesana muy habilosa ya que sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad y muy requeridos por las personas por el buen acabado que tiene.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina lives in the Third Ring area of Santa Cruz [Santa Cruz is a circular city, with each neighborhood known as a “ring” (anillo). Each ring is 1-2 km across, and the numbers increase as you move farther from the city center.] She lives with her children in the family home. Her husband is currently in Brazil for work. 

Cristina makes her living by making and selling embroidered sandals. She embroiders them by hand, which is a very delicate job because it uses very tiny stones and sequins. She also makes bracelets and key chains, which again are hand-embroidered. These items are sold in the Barrio Lindo market in Santa Cruz on Saturdays. 

The loan is for the purchase of threads and materials to create bracelets and sandal embroidery since there is an increase in sales during the holidays at the end of the year. In this way, she will be able to improve her income. Señora Cristina is a skilled artisan because her handicrafts are of very good quality and are in great demand because they are well-made.

loans.use: to purchase materials like threads and sequins for the embroidery of sandals.

loans.name: Jonatan Enrique

texts.es:
Jonatán, vive con su madre, tiene casa propia, él es soltero, se dedica a la venta de medicina, aprendió a manejarlo desde hace 4 años, recorre varios lugares ofreciendo de sus productos y tambien en su casa.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicina natural, preparada con productos naturales que se utilizan para enfermedades respiratorias, internas entre otras, comprara vitamitas, analgesicos, descongestinantes, y otras compuestas para diferentes enfermedades.
Esta compra le ayudara para que este joven pueda surtir su negocio y mantener todo lo necesario para atender la demanda.
texts.en:
Jonatán lives with his mother in their own home. He is single and sells medicines. He has learned how to manage his business for the past four years. Jonatán travels to different places to offer his products, but he also sells from home.

He is requesting a loan to buy medicines that are prepared with natural products used for respiratory and digestive illnesses. Jonatán will buy vitamins, analgesics, decongestants, and other remedies for various illnesses. This purchase will help him to restock his business and maintain everything he needs so that he can keep up with demand.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, analgesics, decongestants, and other remedies.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and is married with three children between the ages of 22 and 16, with the last two still in school. She has been in active farming for 5 years and sells her produce of milk and maize to the local market.

Prisca has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to expand her dairy farming by buying and insuring an additional dairy cow at 31,200 KES as well as to venture into poultry farming by purchasing poultry birds with the remaining 30,000 KES. She aspires to be among the leading dairy farmers in the future.

Prisca mentions recurrent animal diseases as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
Ruth Mery tiene 22 años edad, es soltera y nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Ruth Mery estudio la carrera técnica de administración de hotelera en uno de los institutos más prestigiosos de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Ruth Mery trabaja en uno de los restaurantes más concurridos de la ciudad del Cusco como mozo. Ya son meses que trabaja en el restaurante y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde de lunes a sábados. Ruth Mery y sus papas tienen el negocio de la crianza de animales en su domicilio ósea en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja en la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ruth Mery requiere el préstamo para comprar más ganado.  Su sueño de Ruth Mery es estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho y abrir una agencia de viajes de turismo.    
 
Ruth Mery es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Ruth Mery is 22 years old and single. She was born in the province of Urubamba but currently lives in the city of Cusco where she works.

Ruth Mery studied hotel administration in one of the most prestigious institutes in the city of Cusco.  Currently she works as a waiter in one of the busiest restaurants in Cusco.  It has been a few months already that she has been working in the restaurant and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She works from 6 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon from Monday through Saturday.

Ruth Mery and her parents have a business raising animals at home, in the village of Rumichaca Baja in the city of Urubamba.  They have been doing this work for several years now and it is going very well for them.  Right now Ruth Mery needs the loan to buy more livestock.  Her dream is to study law and open a tourist agency. 

Ruth Mery is a member of the Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja group, made up of 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja where they carry out their work.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Barangay, Masabud Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age and married with five children. Her husband is a farmer.

To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business, raising and harvesting vegetables to sell. She sells her harvested vegetables to the public market in her town. 

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income. 

She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to provide good nourishment to her plants and vegetable seedlings. 

Rosemarie's revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 72 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with four children. 

Arsenia has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 6000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a smallholder farmer based in Kipsaina, Kitale which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has 2 children. He makes a living raising livestock and farming crops. His highest annual expenses are food and education.

The major challenge that David faces is poor access to transportation services. He is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably priced motorcycle, made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain, and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.

With the motorcycle, David will be able to distribute his produce to new locations far from his home.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of the business to meet customers demand.

loans.name: Nazile

texts.en: Nazile is a low income person, originally from the Masalli district of Azerbaijan.She moved to Baku and started her business in 1998. During 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,100. Nazile wants to borrow $1,200 to increase the variety of her trade goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata T. runs a business selling onions and hot peppers.  She is forty-five years old and married with three children.  Fatmata’s children are still young and in school.  Although her husband is employed as a driver, Fatmata needs to earn income to help support the family.  She runs her business in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone) and would like a loan so that she can purchase her products wholesale to earn more profit from her little business.

loans.use: Increase her inventory by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
My name is Alba Luz; my main source of income is retailing and I rely on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes serves prepared foods) in my house called Pulperia "Las Gemelas" (The Twins). The pulperia generates income so that I can contribute to paying family expenses and, consequently, improve both my family's income and our standard of living. I currently need a bigger investment to satisfy existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Alba Luz, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamda Pulperia "Las Gemelas" la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia. actualmente necesito de mayor inversión para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Audilia

texts.en:
Audilia is 40 years old and has 9 children and 4 grandchildren. Eight of her children/grandchildren still live with her in her home. She is not married, so she is the sole supporter of her family . All her children go to school, and one goes to the university in the nearby town of La Romana. Audilia is Haitian by origin, but was born in the Dominican Republic.

Audilia's small house is located on the side of the highway that goes from El Seybo to La Romana. This way she is able to cater to passersby who drop by her little store. She sells different products depending on the season. Right now she is selling avocados and plantains. She says that the market for her produce picks up once the sugarcane season starts because there are more people moving through the area, so she has more customers.

With her loans from Esperanza Audilia was able to buy the plot of land surrounding her house, which she uses as a small farm to grow her produce. She has built a little hut next to her produce stand and wants to stock it with other foods and convenience items, such as a rice, sugar, and charcoal. That is what she is going to concentrate this next loan on.

loans.use: To expand her business by selling rice, sugar and charcoal as well as produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chairs, tables etc.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en: I am Anwer B.. I was married 27 years ago and live with my family in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I have three kids: two sons and one daughter. I sew clothes on order from my neighborhood clients, and my husband runs a grocery store. We need a loan of $350 to buy plastic bowls and plates for our store; it is because our customers always demand them. We hope this addition will turn into higher profits, which I will save to repair my house.

loans.use: Buy plastic bowls and plates for the store

loans.name: Amazonas Group

texts.en:
Amazonas is the name of this association which they identity with the characteristics of: determination, readiness to fight, ability to hunt, persistence to successfully reach objectives for their welfare and that of their family. For the most part, Amazonas dedicates themselves to the tailoring and creation of clothing that they sell in local fairs and in some cases they take them to the center of the country. Currently, they require money to enter into the production and wholesale market. This money will be used to invest in the purchase of materials and skilled labor in order to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Amazonas es el nombre de esta Asociación, que ve en las características de estas mujeres guerreras, decididas y cazadoras, su identidad para seguir adelante en los proyectos trazados, para su subsistencia y la de sus familias. En su mayoría, las Amazonas se dedican a la costura y confección de prendas de vestir, las que comercializan en las principales ferias de su zona, y en algunos casos llevan al interior del país. Actualmente ellas precisan de dinero para poder incursionar en la producción y venta mayorista, para esto requieren invertir capital en la compra de materiales y mano de obra calificada que colabore en el incremento de producción.

loans.use: Currently they require money to enter into the production and wholesale market.  This money will be used to invest in the purchase of materials and skilled labor in order to increase production.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat N. Rahmatulloevich lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a college degree in agronomy. He is in the business of raising cattle. He purchase calves, raises them and resells them at the market at a profit. Raising a calf takes about 40-45 days. After selling the animal he uses the obtained money to purchase new calves that he raises and resells as well. He has more than 6 years experience working in this business. This business is the main source of income for his family and therefore Karomat makes sure that it functions very well. In addition to being crucial to the wellbeing of the N. family, the business also provides local butchers and therefore local markets with affordable meat. Karomat plans to use the money from the loan to purchase another calf to raise. He plans to repay the loan in a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нуров Каромат Рахматуллоевич житель района Файзабад. Возраст 52 года , женат имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее. По профессии Агроном. Работает в сфере животноводства. Покупает бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Откармливает бычков около 40-45 дней.После реализации покупает новых бычков и опять продает. опыт в этой сфере около 6 лет .Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому его бизнес налажен.Кроме того он дает возможность мясникам обеспечивать рынки района мясом, по доступным ценам. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести дополнительного бычка для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. buys cocoa from the farmers and sells it to a company called OLAM GH Ltd Co. His wife is a fishmonger and they have eight dependents. Business is going well and he plans to increase sales but he has inadequate funds.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr:
