This young woman lives in the outskirts of the town of Diourbel, to be precise in the neighborhood of Ndayane. She has a problem in that she has no place to sell her products from, so she does ambulant sales. She makes and sells incense, but she also gets products on credit from shopowners such as soaps and other personal care products. She wants to reinforce her little business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Cette jeune dame habite la banlieue de la ville de Diourbel, précisément le vieux quartier de Ndayane, confrontée à un problème local pour abriter ses produits, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce ambulant. Elle fabrique et vend de l’encense, mais aussi, elle travaille avec les boutiquiers qui lui donnent des produits à crédits comme les savons, et autres produits de nettoyage. Elle veut renforcer ses activités

loans.use:
to reinforce her little business venture

Renforcer ses activités

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima B., wife of Mr. A. A., is a mother of four sisters and four sons. She has been living in this small city of Pakistan for the last 30 years. She lives in a house which is a 4 room brick house. She requires a loan for her husband to invest in her wheat business. They all have been working in this profession for the last so many years. She hopes that if she gets the benefit of this loan, she will buy washing machine and ceiling fan.

Nusrat B. wants a loan to expand her embroidered clothes business. Rani B. wants a loan to expand her barber salon. Shamim B. and Razia B. want a loan to buy cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa is a member of the Kusikuy Community Bank. Kusikuy means ‘Be happy’ in the Quechua language.

Felipa is 42 years old, married, and has ten children. She lives in the hilly area of Cuchipampa, which is a Quechua word meaning ‘field of pigs’. Felipa knits beautiful sweaters by hand which she sells in various regional fairs. Every week Zenobia travels to the fairs to buy cheese and meat that she then sells door to door.

Felipa needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy cheese, wool, and various grains.

Her dream is to see her business grow, to have a nest egg of her own, to have children with professional jobs, and to have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.

Felipa es casada, tiene 42 años y 10 hijos, Felipa vive en la loma de un cerro llamado Cuchipampa que significa pampa de cerdos en quechua, Felipa teje bellas chompas a mano que vende en las diferentes ferias de la región, sus viajes los realiza semanalmente, de las ferias compra queso, carne, que vende caminando de casa en casa.

Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, lana y cereales variados.

Los sueños de Felipa son que su negocio crezca, tener capital propio, sus hijos sean profesionales y estar bien de salud.

loans.use: Felipa needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cheese, wool, and various grains.

loans.name: Gladys Reyna

texts.en:
Gladys, a member of the Las Hormigas Village Bank, is a 38-year-old mother of four children. She hopes to get married to her partner as soon as possible. Gladys sells various sorts of wool in the city of Ayacucho from Wednesday to Saturday. She sells the wool for others to make blankets, sweaters, etc., and purchases the raw materials from the city of Lima. Furthermore, Gladys has a small store in her house where she sells vegetables, meat, and fruit with the help of her children.

Gladys needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in different colored wool.

Glady’s dream is to buy a car, to construct nice floors for her house, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in different colored wool

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is 47 years old and she attended school until Grade 8. Her parents were poor. Her father was a labourer and their land was barren because they did not have the financial resources to sow seeds. Her mother was a merchant, raising 7 children, two of whom went to school and 5 went to work right away. She lives in the district of Razuri in the province of Ascope in the La Libertad quarter.

Her husband being a labourer did not earn very much money so she started selling soft drinks and rice, something she started using her own money and later she decided to expand and invest in a small eatery to help her husband with the finances. This member received an invitation from the municipality to attend a conference held by the ONG Manuela Ramos in Puerto Malabrigo. Soon after she decided to become a member of the community bank Malabrigo II, the establishment providing loans to women in need. She has been with Manuela Ramos for 1 year and her first loan, amounting to S./300.00, she purchased pastas, cooking oils, sugar, snacks and sweets, soft drinks, rice, and beer.

This loan, amounting to S/.800.00, will be repaid in a term of 6 months and she will invest the funds in the purchase of soft drinks, pastas, sweets and snacks, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

This member dreams of owning her own hotel, a bar, and she dreams of building her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irma, tiene 47 años, estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria, sus padres eran humildes, su Papá era obrero y la chacra que tenían estaba abandonada porque no tenían los recursos económicos para sembrar, su Mamá era comerciante, tiene 07 hijos, 02 son estudiantes y 05 trabajan, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como su esposo era obrero y no ganaba mucho, entonces empezó a vender gaseosa, arroz con capital propio, al poco tiempo después decidió ampliar la bodega y al mismo tiempo invertir en un negocio de comida, para ayudar a su esposo. La socia recibió una invitación del Municipio para asistir a una reunión de la ONG Manuela Ramos en el Puerto Malabrigo, luego decidió trabajar en el Banco Comunal “MALABRIGO II” por la facilidad de otorgar préstamo a las mujeres de escasos recursos, tiene 01 trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró fideos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas, arroz, cerveza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de gaseosa, pasta de dientes, golosinas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. La socia sueña con tener un hotel, un bar, construir su casa.

loans.use: To purchase various products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T. is a 49-year-old widow. Her husband unluckily passed away a long time ago. So at present she lives with her two children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. In 2006 she joined TYM Fund.

Today her family's main business is fruit selling. Besides, she has additional income from animal raising. With an income of VND 2 million/month, she has no difficulty in repaying her loans. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 9 million to invest in fruit selling and broom selling.

loans.use: to sell fruit and brooms

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en: Mehriniso E. is 38 years old and she is the loving mother of 4 children. Mehriniso and her husband are living together with her husband's parents. In order to help her husband to support their large family, Mehriniso started her own business. For the last 2 years, Mehriniso has raised cattle and then sold them at the market. With the help of the loan, Mehriniso plans to increase her livestock and to generate additional profit.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Dario Paulino

texts.es: El cliente tiene 1 hija, y su esposa es quien le ayuda en LA OBLIGACIONES del hogar. asimimo la esposa es ayudante de cocina. El cliente se dedica al trozado de carne a primeras horas de la mañana y posteriormente se dedica a conducir su vehiculo de taxi. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en ambas actividades y es muy conocido en el medio. En la actividad del trozado de carne no tiene mucha competencia  y en el servicio de taxi existe bastante afluencia de gente por la zona en el sector donde trabaja por lo que es media la competencia. el cliente con el credito obtenido comprara un maquina de cortar y herramientas ya que anteriormente era dependiente ahora se esta independisando  en el rubro de cortado de carne. Se trata de la cuarta secuencia del cliente con Agrocapital, los anteriores creditos los cancelo con normalidad.
texts.en:
Dario has one daughter and his wife helps him maintain the household and does the cooking. He works cutting up meat in the morning and after that he works driving a taxi. He has a lot of experience in both jobs and knows them well. There is not very much competition in meat cutting but there is a lot of competition in the taxi business because of the affluence of the people in the area where he works. With this loan he will buy a cutting machine and tools. He was dependent before, but now he is making himself independent in the area of cutting meat. This is the fourth loan that he will be receiving from Agrocapital, and all his previous loans were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand P. is already a widower at the age of 36. His two children serve as his inspiration to move on and work hard in order to send them to school. His eldest is Jane, 15 years old, a senior high school student and the other one is Fredimar, 14 years old and a junior high school student. They live in Barangay Rizal and their house is located just near their rice field, since the place is surrounded by agricultural land.

Ferdinand is busy managing his farm. With the help of his carabao (water buffalo) and cow, cultivating his rice field becomes a little easier. Thus, to avoid having debts from traders with high interest, Ferdinand is requesting a loan of only PHP10, 000.00 that he can use to purchase the farm inputs he needs.

Aside from farming, Ferdinand is also maintaining native mango trees which are harvested once a year. He is thankful that he can easily sell the mangoes at their market.

His dream is for his business to prosper so he can provide the educational needs of his children especially when they reach the college level. To fulfill his family's dream, Ferdinand is striving to work hard.

loans.use: additional working capital for his farm

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Hong Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Hong H. is a village bank group president of nineteen people, who all live in Phum Saeprammuoy village, in Kampong Cham province. Each member of the group plans to use the loan, which they obtained, for a different purpose. For instance, Mrs. Kim Hong H. is requesting a loan to buy grocery products to increase her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Suon Sarorn, is a construction worker who earns a small income, bareL. enough to support the famiL.. Aside from this business, he is a cow breeder. Mrs. Kim Hong H. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, one is employed at a garment factory, while the remaining four are construction workers. 
One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loan, and the other members have monthL. payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to increase her store inventory

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Jacinta es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Jacinta viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende  frutas, lanas, panes y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Jacinta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y trigo.
Los sueños de Jacinta son que su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y tener capital propio para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the community bank Triomphe. Jacinta is 63 years old, and married with 6 children. She travels to fairs in the region where she sells fruit, wool, and breads. At the fairs, Jacinta purchases cereals to sell in the markets of Ayacucho city. Jacinta needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in purchasing corn and wheat. Jacinta dreams that, (1) her youngest son completes his studies, and that (2) she has her own financial capital to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and wheat.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Ella trabaja en su fábrica D. ladrillos, la cual obtuvo hace 2 años. Todo comenzó como un proyecto familiar, adquiriendo un terreno arcilloso (el material requerido para la fabricación D. ladrillos), lo que le dio buenos resultados, ya que ahora ha repartido una parcela a cada uno D. sus hijos, a fin D. que cada uno tenga su propia fábrica. Esto no perjudica el mercado D. Gloria, ya que existe una alta demanda en este rubro. Actualmente produce hasta 23 millares D. ladrillos por mes, teniendo que contratar a personas que la ayuden, Luisa les paga por millar, y tiene que estar pendiente todo el día supervisando el trabajo. Su deseo es seguir trabajando porque quiere mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad D. su producto. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta por ser parte D. su banco comunal y seguirá trabajando con responsabilidad para el bienestar D. todos. El dinero que solicita será usado en la compra D. una camionada D. aserrín que cuesta en promedio D. 1200 soles y la otra parte la invertirá en el pago del jornal D. sus empleados, ya que en esta ocasión aumentará su producción.
texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She works in her own brick-making operation, which she acquired 2 years ago. It all began as a family project with the acquisition of a piece of land with clay dirt (material needed to make bricks), and the results were good so now she has given a piece of the land to each of her children so that they can have their own production. This does not affect her as there is a high demand for bricks. She currently produces up to 23,000 a month and has hired people to help her. Luisa pays them for each 1,000 bricks and spends all day supervising their work. She hopes to keep working because she wants to continue to improve the quality of her product. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP. She is pleased to be part of the communal bank and will keep working responsibly for the well-being of everyone. The money she requests will be used to buy a truck-load of sawdust which will cost an average of 1,200 soles and another part will be used to pay her employees since their production will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sawdust and pay her day workers.

loans.name: Eddah I.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Eddah M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 18. Eddah has been running a soft-drinks and poultry-keeping business since 2000. She purchases drinks wholesale then sells them retail, and she keeps chickens. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by 4 employees. Eddah currently earns about $350 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $700 USD in order to purchase soft drinks and poultry feed in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the number and variety of products in her business. Eddah thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and poultry feed in bulk

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva D. is thirty two years old, married and the mother of two children. Fortunately all her children are currently in school. She is really dedicated to her work and supportive to her children. By her own effort and hard work, Eva has been able to enroll her children  in private school. She sells cosmetic products in the local community of Eguase where she lives. She believes she can make her business grow bigger with loan support. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She believes this would help her save towards the children's education. Eva has been selling through hawking, ie house to house selling, for ten years. She is planning to rent a store to reduce the frequent hawking. With the loan she is sure that all her dreams will be achieved. Eva will be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua Kuo’ which literally means God’s family.

loans.use: To use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo A. Jr. is 30 years old and married to Gemalyn. They were gifted with one child. The family is happily living in Barangay San Roque at Centro Enrile, Cagayan. Domingo works as a tricycle driver in their town of Enrile, Province of Cagayan. His business serves as the main source of income for his family. He sometimes does furniture work but because he does not have enough capital, he just focuses in operating his tricycle.

When Domingo learned about Kiva lenders, he decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle he uses for his business. Hopefully he will save enough capital for his furniture business someday. Despite the hardship they are encountering, Domingo believes that God will not forsake them and they will overcome the challenges that may come.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
"My name is Irshad and I have been a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan for the last 20 years. My husband's name is R. A. and he owns a livestock business. He buys buffalos on order and sells to the required customers. He has 5 years of experience in this business."

Irshad baji helps her husband in taking care of his buffalos. They both are very happy with each other. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to complete the order of her husband's customer.

loans.use: To buy buffalo for livestock business

loans.name: Rusembe 2 West Kiza Monica Group

texts.en:
Monica K. is a 28 year old single mother of three children and a business lady. She also looks after two dependents. All her children go to school.

She has been in her business for over four years. She will use this loan to purchase fresh food, such as cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas, and beans.

Monica is hardworking. Her dream is to expand her business and work hard to earn enough profit to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: ama D. dite oumy est une femme mariée née en 1960 à thies ;elle a en charge six enfants et vit avec son mari à som;son activité consiste à acheter du poisson fumé à joal et la revendre au mali ,elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de dix ans ;elle est à son cinquième pret;après ce financement ,elle envisage d'augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Ama D., also called Oumy, is a married woman who was born in 1960 in Thies. She has six children in her care and lives with her husband in Som. Her business involves buying smoked fish in Joal and reselling them in Mali. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is on her fifth loan. Following this financing, she envisions boosting her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A., forty years old, is a married woman with four children. Janet enjoys selling from which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She is a petty trader who supplies margarine to bakers in her community and other customers in other parts of the country. She has been in business for some time now and, with good customer relations, she has won many customers.

However, Janet buys her supplies on credit at a relatively high price due to lack of adequate working capital. With this loan, she wants to purchase margarine in bulk to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy margarine in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la atención se sus cabinas de Internet, negocio que implementó para poder solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hogar, ya que sus padres que ya están ancianos. Felizmente, este negocio le permite realizarlo en su propia casa sin tener que salir a las calles a ofrecer alguna mercadería. Por otro lado, también comenta que le resulta un poco esclavizante, ya que debe permanecer ahí todo el día. Aparte de sus cabinas de internet y en el afán de conseguir más ingresos, está planeando comprar golosinas y bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes cibernautas. Para el fututo, Elizabeth necesita comprar más computadoras, además de tener un servicio de llamadas telefónicas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable y puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita complementará su negocio comprando más golosinas y mandará a confeccionar los módulos para su centro de llamadas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old, single, and lives in her parent's home. For the last year she has dedicated her attention to her internet booths, a business she started to meet her own personal expenses and also those of her home, since her parents are getting older.

Fortunately, this business allows her to work in her own home without going out on the street to sell merchandise. On the other hand, this means the business can feel a bit enslaving, since she must remain there all day. Apart from her internet. Apart from her internet booths, in an attempt to increase her income, she is planning to buy candy and drinks to offer to her internet clients.

For the future, Elizabeth needs to buy more computers. Additionally she would like to have a telephone calling service to increase her profits. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible and punctual with her payments. With the money she is asking for she will round out her business by buying more candy and sending the modules for her call center to the manufactures.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sweets and investment in another part of her business

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel C. is a 29-year-old rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He is also the young father of two children. He wants to achieve success, especially in having an abundant harvest to provide for the needs and demands of his family.

Roel is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to purchase insecticide, two bags of ammonium sulfate fertilizer, and other farm inputs. These, according to him, will help the size of his harvest and his income as well.

Roel likes CEVI because it offers very low interest rates (2% a month). He said that, aside from loan, he also receives insurance and training from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase insectide, two bags ammonium sulfate fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Rebeca del Socorro García  M. ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales los dos son mayores de edad. La señora García M. se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general de forma ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  16 años, debido a que quería brindar un mayor sustento a su familia. Ya que su esposo laboraba  pero no ganaba lo suficiente. Desde ese tiempo ella ha sabido manejar sus inventarios, de forma que ahora tiene un negocio bien establecido. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos y de ropa, ya que actualmente tiene buenos pedidos. Su  esposo trabaja como chofer de un microbús de forma ambulante. Su sueño es llegar a tener una buena tienda en el mercado municipal que le brinde estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia en general.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 52 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. El negocio al que se dedica Guillermina son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que elabora son muy novedosos. Lo que más le gusta a Guillermina de su trabajo es tejer y mejor aun si son artesanías, lleva 9 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Guillermina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y puntuales. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para confeccionar más tejidos artesanales y aumentar su stock.

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Intachables Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Intachables" están representadas por la señora Victoria y conformada por 12 miembros los cual, son un grupo de señoras que viven en los alrededores de  las cabañas del río Pirai, que se ayudan entre si, se conocen ya desde hace muchos años todas tienen diferentes tipos de negocios tales como venta de frutas, cosméticos, algunas venden comida a los ripieros que trabajan en el río, refrescos, ropa y al transporte público de pasajeros. Debido a que la competencia es muy dura en estos días las señoras utilizan el dinero que se les presta para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción o ampliar el stock de productos que tienen. Las socias van cumpliendo ya su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas de sacar adelante a su familia y poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The members of the "Intachables" (Impeccable) Community Bank are represented by Mrs. Victoria and made up of 12 members, all of whom are women who live near the shacks of the Pirai River. They help one another and have known each other for many years. They all have different types of businesses, such as sales of fruit or cosmetics, some sell food to the men who work on the river, some sell soft drinks or clothing, and some work in public transportation. Since competition is very fierce these days, the women use their loan money in order to increase their production capacity or increase their stock of products. The members are completing their second loan cycle and have demonstrated punctuality and a will to help their families get ahead and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 46-year-old man, married, with 10 children. He works hard as a farmer to provide better living conditions for his big family. He has been in agriculture for more than 30 years.

Today, Ahmad is applying for a loan of $1000 to purchase seedlings to cultivate more agriculture products in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina, age 45, has five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade. She works to help her husband to provide for the family. Rosina is a trader in palm fruits. She buys the palm fruits from nearby communities and villages, and supplies them to retailers and palm oil producers in her community. Rosina also sells at the local market. She has been in this business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business. She believes the loan would enable her to inject more working capital into her trade, allowing her to raise more income to support her children at school. Rosina says her kids are her future security and it is her desire to see them attain a high level of  quality education.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil P. owns a sari-sari store. She is happy about her business because it helps her provide for the needs of her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Aside from fish, her family relies on the income she makes in her store. She has five children and her eldest is just 18 years old. She is doing the very best she can to improve her business. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 16,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
Leovina es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y ropa de segundo uso la cual ofrece a diferentes caseríos del distrito y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace tres años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en la compra de ropa de segundo uso.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de productos como son: arroz, leche, fideos, azúcar, etc. para ser vendidos en la bodega que pondrà.
La meta de Leovina es surtir su negocio de abarrotes y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Leovina is a hardworking and active woman, who lives in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are older in age. She dedicates her profession to the sale of sodas and second-hand clothing which she offers at different farmhouses of the district, and her husband is dedicated to agriculture. She has been part of the Las Nazarenas Community Bank for 3 years and the first credit she received was for 300 PEN which she invested in the purchase of second-hand clothing. Currently she needs a credit of 500 PEN which she will use in the purchase of products such as rice, milk, noodles, sugar and other goods to sell in the store she will have. Leovina's goal is to grow and improve her grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foodstuff to sell in a store out of her home

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix G. es un comerciante antiguo del distrito

de Cambyreta su comercio lleva el nombre de Despensa El 

Abuelo, vive en casa propia es casado y tiene dos hijos.

 

Su comercio tiene ya varios años y tambien realiza pastas, dulces y helados.  

 

El destino del credito fue para la compra de

mercaderias para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Señor Felix G. is an old merchant of the Cambyreta district. His business has the name Despensa El Abuela. He lives in his own house and has 2 children. His business is many years old and he makes pastas, sweets and ice creams. This loan is destined for the purchase of grocery items to expand his stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wenifredo

texts.en: Wenifredo, 43, is a farmer with a poultry business in Norala, South Cotabato. He has three children to support. The income he receives from his business is quite enough to sustain his family. He is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva's partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to buy feed for his chickens and supplies for his farm.

loans.use: Feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Phat Tuy Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat T. is 48 years old and is the group leader of a 15 person group.

Mrs. Phat T. is a widow with three children, one of whom works in a garment factory, while another is a student in the local school, while the youngest is only 5 years old. They all live in Pris Leu village, Takeo province.

Mrs. Phat T. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field used to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also breeds pigs to earn a small income to support her family. In other to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle, she is requesting a 800,000 loan from AMK to buy more pigs and pig food for breeding.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig food

loans.name: Azucena 1 Group

texts.en:
Deysi is the coordinator of her group Azucena, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her five children.

Deysi is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, selling clothing, by purchasing underwear, mosquito nets, pants, blouses and skirts in the main market in Santo Domingo and then selling it in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to proviD. the daily needs for her large family and save for her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, pants, mosquito nets, underwear

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet B. is from the village of San Luis, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marycil

texts.en: Marycil is married to Jeffrey and they now have four children. The oldest is 12. She does farming for a living. She and her husband cultivate their land for rice crops. She said she wants all her children to have a proper education and a bright future so she also works hard to achieve it. She spends her whole day at the farm to be sure it will be productive. She currently needs farm inputs for it so she applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of PHP6,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita R. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old, separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bernandita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernandita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Bernandita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 49 years old and lives with her father in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her children have grown up and live on their own. Oyunchimeg and her father have been living together in their current home for 10 years. Oyunchimeg operates a consumer products trading business at a local trading center. She buys about 800,000 tugrugs (~ 570 USD) worth of products per year to sell. Oyunchimeg has been successfully operating her business since December 2008. She started her business with working capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~ 285 USD), but after only two years Oyunchimeg has managed to increase her working capital to 2,500,000 tugrugs (~  1775 USD). With this year's earnings, she has purchased furniture and electrical appliances for her home. In addition, she has expanded her original counter, and purchased another counter for her business. Oyunchimeg is a very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to expand my business and to build a house in my yard." She is requesting a 1,800,000-tugrug loan to purchase more consumer products at wholesale prices for 1,000,000 tugrugs and to purchase a fridge and freezer for 800,000 tugrugs.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Kutimuy” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas D. L. unidad D. micro finanzas D. L. Asociación Arariwa D. L. ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 13  y está conformado por 20 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a lo que se dedican son a las ventas D. chocolates, comestibles, materiales D. construcción, confección D. manualidades y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo, guía D. turismo,  agencia D. transportes, empleado administrativo y enfermera. 

Carmen, tiene 52 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender su tienda D. abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo, elL. requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza y gaseosas. Olga forma parte D. L. junta directiva del banco comunal desD. el año 1992  y es una D. las fundadoras del banco comunal. Su sueño D. L. socia es tener una ferretería.
 
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. L. región sur del país.
texts.en:
The members of “Kutimuy” communal bank meet every thirty days in Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit’s offices in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is currently in its 13th cycle and it’s composed of 20 hard-working and enterprising members who constantly seek ways to succeed and to proviD. a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell chocolate, food, building materials and supplies while some make crafts; others proviD. services such as: tourist guides, public transport, administrative employee, nursing. Carmen, 52, is married and has three children; her main commercial activity is grocery sales. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs funds to increase her stock, especially beer and soft-drinks. Olga has been a member of the governing board of the communal bank since 1992; she’s one of the founding members. Her dream is to own a hardware store. All the members value and appreciate the loan granted through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it’s an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 50 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Danilo plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-one years and earns approximately $1125 per harvest.

In 2006, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be his 8th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Francisca Mercedes

texts.es: Francisca Mercedes C. D. B. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Bosques del Matazano en el departamento D. Soyapango, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 20 años D. edad, el cual es un joven muy responsable quien se dedica a estudiar y así mismo a ayudar a atender el negocio D. su madre. Francisca posee una panadería en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, el cual es un negocio bastante estable, así mismo posee un bazar en el cual comercializa piñatas, gorros, platos, y todo tipo D. accesorios para fiestas D. cumpleaños, también comercializa ropa para bebe, dulces, regalos para diferentes ocasiones, tarjetas, cosméticos y otras cosas más. Francisca es muy conocida en la zona por ser alguien muy esforzada y trabajadora, así mismo por ser muy amable y brindar muy buenos precios a sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en el bazar, ya que este es un negocio bastante estable el cuan cuenta con muy buena demanda, es por esto que Francisca desea contar con accesorios y productos muy necesarios para que las personas compren más y D. esta forma percibir más ganancias, la cuales permitan al mismo tiempo ir creciendo más como comerciante y así mismo poder contar con todo lo necesario en el hogar lo cual es primordial.
texts.en:
Francisca Mercedes C. D. B., 50, lives in Bosques del Matazano in the Soyapango department with her husband and 20-year-old son, a very responsible young man who studies and helps attend to his mother's business. Francisca has a bakery where she works with her husband. It is a very stable business, and they also have a store where they sell piñatas, caps, plates and all types of accessories for birthday parties. They also sell baby clothing, candy, gifts for various occasions, cards, cosmetics and other items. Francisca is very well known in the area as a very dedicated and hard-working woman, and also for being very pleasant and offering very good prices to her customers. She is requesting this loan to invest more in the store, as this business is very stable and has a good amount of demand. Francisca wants to have the necessary accessories and products for people to buy more and this way she will have better earnings. This will allow her to keep growing as a businesswoman and to have all the necessities at home, which is paramount.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Party and gift accessories

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Djekafo Togo

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe 2 de l’association Djekafo de Togo sont des femmes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de cultures et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition à temps en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles cultivent du mil, de l’oseille de Guinée, du sésame, du haricot et de l’arachide. 
Madame Satou Fané  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3sacs d’engrais, 50 kg de grains d’arachide de semence et recruter avec le reste d’argent de la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). Avec une superficie de 3hectare, elle espère produire 800 kg d’haricot, 18 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil et des fanes d’haricot destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes d’haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est stockée et vendue petit à petit pour des besoins de condiments et  cas sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles). 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Satou Fané  a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants pour s’équiper en matériels agricoles.
texts.en:
The five members of group 2 of the association Djekafo of Togo are married women in major traditional families with an average of 42 years in age and 4 children. They all live in the village of Togo in the rural neighborhood of Skoïba in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other from relationships, marriages and the neighborhood. With the goal of expanding their farm land and having agricultural fertilizer ready in time for the beginning of winter, they resorted to Soro Yiriwaso and are in their 2nd cycle of a farm loan. They cultivate millet, hibiscus flowers, sesame, beans, and peanuts. Ms. Satou Fané intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacs of fertilizer, 50kg of seed peanuts and recruit, with the rest of the money, workforce for the jobs of plowing and weeding. She gets fresh supplies of seed and fertilizer at the Ségou faire (at the big market). With an plot of 3 hectares, she hopes to produce 800 kg of beans, 18 sacs of peanuts, 4 sacs of millet and bean stocks to make bales. The bales of beans are stored and sold during the off-season. A part of the harvest is consumed by herself, while the other half is stored and sold little by little for condiment needs and social occasions (marriage, baptisms and funerals). Like all the other members of the group, Ms. Satou Fané has as a goal to raise small ruminants to equip herself with agricultural materials.

Translated from French by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, seed peanuts, and paying for labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. T. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine runs a store buying and selling products such as earrings and necklaces. She also offers ear-piercing services. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Simon Kipngetuny

texts.en:
Simon Kipngetuny C. is a man of 57 years. He is married to Salina and they are blessed with four beautiful children. Simon and his wife are both farmers who live in the Mafuta area in the outskirts of Eldoret. He plants maize and wheat for resale after harvest and has been in this business for 10 years now. He gets a yearly income of 150,000 Kenyan shillings.

With this loan, Simon plans to buy fertilizer for his farm, and with the interest he is going to get, he plans to expand his farming business. In the future, he plans to feed, clothe and provide for his family and expand his farming business by renting more plots for planting maize and wheat.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta B. smokes fish at Takoradi for sale. Atta has been through senior high school.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a mason. 

Atta has been selling smoked fish for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Abetereine Rushango Association, Ibanda Group

texts.en: M. Scovia is a member of the Abetereine Rushango Association in Ibanda. She is a hardworking and well trained medical personnel who has been running a pharmacy alongside banana selling in Rushango, Ibanda. Her business has been operating for 6 years and has always brought to her dividends close to 160,000 UGX monthly. Her main drawback is having a small stock which is hindering business growth and expansion. With this loan, the widowed mother of 2 children looks forward to restocking drugs, which will allow her to earn more revenue and acquire a self-sustaining life through educating her children.

loans.use: purchase of more drugs

loans.name: Dafney

texts.en:
Dafney O. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Dafney is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Dafney owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Dafney has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Dafney joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dafney is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Dafney's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with three children all of whom graduated from school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites her rent bill and food as her greatest monthly expenses. 

For over twenty years, she has been weaving mats (makuti) using coconut palm leaves. She sells the mats to hoteliers who use them in thatching their roofs. Dama's major challenge is transportation. The weaving mats are transported from rural areas to urban areas for resale. She hopes to own a house in the future. 

Dama decided to join Yehu to get a loan and improve her business. With the 20,000 KES she wants to start another business of selling dried fish.

loans.use: To start another business of selling dried fish.

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele A. is from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Arcele is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Arcele owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Arcele has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arcele joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arcele has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arcele is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Arcele from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes-selling business for over four years. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation as she has to move from one place to another selling clothes. She hopes to open a boutique in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase clothes and ornaments for resale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and ornaments for resale

loans.name: Saadoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and a married man who has two children. Two of his siblings live with him.

He used to work in a service-based business but he decided to open his own coffee shop with pool tables in 2009. He rented a place and started his business. He has a good reputation in his local community.

He applied for a US$ 2400 loan to renovate his coffee shop so it will be more entertaining for his customers. And this way he will improve his and his family's standards of living.

loans.use: Renovating his coffee shop

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo A. is from the town of Talibon. He is 34 years old, married and has 4 children aged 11, 9, 7 and 4. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Eduardo works hard to build his business. He hopes it will be stable.
Eduardo joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sugey del Socorro A. M.,  tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, un barrio de la capital conocido por la Policía Nacional como uno de los barrios más peligrosos por la delincuencia que amenaza a sus habitantes, ella habita en una humilde casa que con los años se ha deteriorado y necesitan unas remodelaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los suyos, ellos sobreviven con limitados recursos su esposo es Electromecánico pero las ofertas de trabajo han disminuido, y bajo sus propios recursos no lograran realizar sus planes, espera le apoyen a mejorar sus condiciones actuales de habitad.
texts.en: Mrs Sugey del Socorro A. M. is 33 years old.  She lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood which is known by the National Police as one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in the capital due to the crime that threatens its residents.  Sugey lives in a modest home which has deteriorated over time and needs some remodelling work to improve her family's security and comfort.  The family have few economic resources.  Her husband is an electromechanical engineer but work offers have fallen and they cannot carry out their plans using their own finances.  Sugey hopes that you will help them to improve their current living conditions.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food for sale

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak Su is 52 years old and has been cultivating rice on her own farmland for many years. She plants rice in both the rainy season and the dry season, and she often receives a good return from her farming business. She is married to Samrate Moun, 55, who earns a living by fishing in and around the lakes of their community. They have three married children, and three single children. Three of the children are employed as sewing workers at the garment factory. Currently, Prak Su wishes to rent a piece of farmland from her neighbor at a low price.  She will use this land for growing more rice. Prak Su is seeking a loan from Kiva to rent the land. 

Note: Prak Su and her son are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To rent farmland from her neighbor

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica tiene 37 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella es asesora de una inmobiliaria y sus funciones hacer trámites documentarios, ella se encarga de asesorar a las personas que desean obtener casas en alquiler, también se dedica a la venta de casa y otras cosas más. Monica requiere el préstamo para uso personal y no quiso especificar para que exactamente es el uso del dinero. 

Monica pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Monica is 37 and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. As well as doing her housework she works as a real estate consultant. Her responsibilities include doing paperwork; she advises people looking to rent a house. She also sells houses and other activities. Monica needs the loan for personal use and prefers not to specify exactly what the money would be for. 

Monica is a member of the "Renovación" ("Renewal") communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The community bank is made up of female entrepreneurs and workers who seek opportunities that will help them raise their children. Cusco is a charming city dating back to Inca times, built on the ancient Inca citadel.

loans.use: For personal use.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa, 51, is married and lives with his wife, two children and two nephews in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own, on the outskirts of the city. His two children who are 25 and 30 are currently unemployed and his two nephews go to kindergarten. His wife helps him with the business. They have a decent standard of living. 

In 1997, Nyamdavaa began operating a food store near his home which is located in a crowded district on the outskirts of the city. Now he has a special license to operate his shop. His daily gross income is 500,000 MNT and his monthly profit is between 600,000-1,000,000 MNT. The food he sells in his shop is purchased from local markets. He was able to build his home with the profits from his business. He is a business-minded, intelligent person who says, " Life is full of good surprises if you truly enjoy them." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell at his store.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una señora muy tediosa ya que a sus 42 años de edad  se dedica a vender comida como ambulante desde hace 7 años,  Blanca no solo se dedica a esta actividad sino también lava ropa ajena para tener un poco mas de ingresos y de esta manera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 son aun menores de edad. Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos y también comprar algunos utensilios que le hace falta  para vender comida como: cucharas, tenedores y platos descartables. A blanca le gustaría tener un restaurante o una bodega.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old and a very hard worker who has been a food peddlar for seven years.  She also has a clothes washing service to earn more income so she can help her husband with the household expenses and meet the needs of her four children, three of whom are still minors.

She plans to use the loan to buy school materials for her children and utensils for her food business, such as disposable spoons, forks and plates.  She would like to have her own restaurant or grocery store some day.

loans.use: To buy school materials and disposable utensils such as plates, spoons and forks

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Rosalina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina raises rice for sale. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 40 years old and has two children. Felipa is married with one child in school.

Felipa is in the agricultural business raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and supplies for her pigs.

Felipa has been in this business for five years. Felipa also earns income with a general store and food vending. 

In the future, Felipa would like to earn and save so that she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and supplies for her pig fattening business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 24 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Eva has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tseepilmaa

texts.en: Tseepilmaa is 43 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her two children are employed while one is a student. She manages a clothing trading business in her town. She started her business in 1992 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. She worked hard to stabilize her business and now her working capital has reached 1,500,000-2,000,000 MNT. She built a strong customer base and is planning to continue her business in the future. She is a diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good managerial skill. She says, "I am thankful to Xacbank for lending me required amount of loan for my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT of loan to purchase clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from China to sell.

loans.name: Ydo

texts.es:
Ydo es un joven de 29 años de edad, él es soltero.  Vive en casa de sus padres quienes lo apoyan el su actividad y en su plan de negocio, su casa esta ubicada en  Tambogrande en la ciudad de  Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Ydo es la venta de productos naturales, labor que realiza recorriendo caseríos cercanos y también en su propio domicilio y cuenta  ya con clientela establecida en su zona.  Ydo realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 4 años y ha adquirido experiencia en esta labor. 

Ydo esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de s/.600.00 nuevos soles   para que el pueda comprar de mas productos, ya que tienen más demanda en zonas rurales y no puede abastecerlas por falta de productos.  Ydo necesita poder atender a sus clientes más rápido, y así logra seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida suya y la de sus padres.

Ydo, es un cliente nuevo y bancarizado por Edpyme Alternativa que tiene muchas probabilidades de seguir creciendo gracias a su espíritu empresarial empeñoso ya su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ydo is a 29 year old man. He is single. He lives in his parents' home and they support his activities and his business plan. Their home is located in the Tambogrande section of the city of Piura. 

Ydo is asking for a loan of $600 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternative in order to buy more products, because he has a lot of demand in rural areas that he can not meet because of a lack of products. Ydo needs to be able to serve his clients more quickly in order to grow his business and improve his and his parents' quality of life. 

Ydo is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has a great chance of growing his business due to his entrepreneurial spirit and his responsibility.

loans.use: to buy products for his business

loans.name: Nuevo Solecito Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA NUEVO SOLECITO PORQUE CON ESTE PRESTAMO QUIEREN INICIAR CON UN NUEVO SOL. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. ESTE GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA ANA LUISA C. ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO LA SECUNDARIA, VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE UN NEGOCIO DONDE VENDE TORTILLAS HECHAS A MANO DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS, SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA MEJORAR EL LOCAL DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE POR AHORA ES DE TRONCOS Y TRIPLAY. AL SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO ESTA MUY EMOCIONADA YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTA OPORTUNIDAD PUDO INICIAR SU NEGOCIO Y POCO A POCO HA CRECIDO Y SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER LA MEJOR TORTILLERIA DE LA LOCALIDAD. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA VA AHORRAR PARA MEJORAR SU CASA Y LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This group was named 'Nuevo Solecito' (New [Little] Sun) because the group members want to start this loan with a new sun.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has eight members.

Ana Luisa C. is the group's president.  She is 24 years old, completed high school, and lives with her partner.  She has run a business selling hand-made tortillas for two years.  She is requesting this loan to improve her business premises as, right now, it is made from logs and plywood.  At the time of requesting this loan, Ana Luisa is very excited because, thanks to this opportunity, she was able to start her business and it has gradually grown.  Her goal is to own the best tortilla bakery in town.  She will use the profits that she makes to save up so that she can improve her home and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to re-build the premises from which she sells her tortillas

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro es un padre de familia de 58 años de edad,  el es casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia la cual está ubicada en el caserío Manco Inca en el distrito de Tambogrande, este  caserío es mediano con deseos de superación.

 Lázaro se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con 4 hectáreas de limón y 2 hectáreas de mango, el limón lo cosecha semanalmente, con lo cual asume sus obligaciones familiares.  Además se dedica ala comercialización de  ganado ovino los cuales cría y engorda en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio su domicilio y después los vende en el mercado local. 

 Lázaro está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda realizar labores de limpieza y comprar fertilizantes para cultivo de limón. Además desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus ovinos  y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 

Lázaro es una persona con buenas referencias muy responsable, las personas que lo conocen como una persona tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Lázaro is a 58-year-old father who is married and has three children. He lives in his own home in the village of Manco Inca in the District of Tambogrande. This medium-sized village has intentions to grow.

Lázaro is a farmer who has four hectares of lemon trees and two hectares of mango trees. The lemons are harvested weekly so that he can meet his family obligations. In addition, he sells sheep that he raises and fattens in pens located behind his home. The animals are sold at the local market.

Lázaro is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can clear his land and buy fertilizers for his lemon crop. In addition, he wants to buy balanced feed for his sheep so that he can sell them at a better price and grow his business.

Lázaro is a responsible person with good references. The people who know him say that he is a peaceful and hardworking individual.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his lemon crop and balanced feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The older son serves in the army and the other children study at school. 

 Anarkan works in the financial group “Kompanion”, and she is also engaged in cultivating agricultural products. She has been doing this for twenty years, since the time she got married.  

Anarkan applied for the loan because they need additional funds for repairing the family vehicle. In the future she wants to see all her children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair the family vehicle.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro pequeño comerciante, con mas de once años, en las ventas, de pollo y carne de res, el cual lo hace en su casa de habitacion. Padre de tres hijos,  ambos cuidan de su familia, su esposa labora en servicios domesticos, logrando cubrir medicina y gastos basicos.
Don Alejandro le ha gustado el comercio, por tal razon inicio con poco y con el apoyo de sus padres, hoy en dia cuenta con su propio capital, el cual lo ha logrado con ganancia de las ventas y financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos, lo que para el es de gran sastifaccion, al producir mas carne, mejores ventas. 
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara una vaca y un cerdo para la venta de carne. Sus planes a futuro es la compra de mas cerdo, lo que espera tener mas utilidades para dicha compra.
texts.en:
Alejandro has a small business with over eleven years experience selling chicken and beef, which he does from his home.  He is a father of three children.  Both he and his wife take care of his family; his wife works in domestic services, managing to cover medicine and basic expenses.

Don Alejandro liked business, accordingly he started with little and with the support of his parents, he now has his own capital.  He achieved this through profits from his sales, and from the financing that Afodenic has given him in two lending cycles.  This gives him great satisfaction, and allows him to produce more meat, and better sales.

With this new loan he will buy a cow and a pig to sell their meat.  His future plans are to buy more pigs, which he hopes to have more profits to purchase.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a pig to continue growing his meat selling business.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en: Braulio is 39 years old and married with two children. His children are 10 and 14 years old. Braulio works as a taxi driver in the city of Cusco. He enjoys his occupation and works everyday. With an 800 USD loan, Braulio plans to invest in his wife's bakery. A large portion of the loan will go to purchasing ingredients for bread, while the rest will be for minor improvements to her store. Braulio and his wife are committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in his wife's bakery

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, age 48, owns and operates a shop that sells frozen foods such as hot dogs and homemade sausage. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale.

Marieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale
