Melona C. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Melona owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Melona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

Melona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melona has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Melona from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: R. Rafiatou est née le 08 Septembre 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rafiatou est mariée à AKILOCHO Idrissou, et est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Rafiatou vit depuis sept ans au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, avec son enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de son enfant, Rafiatou vend des tenues pour enfants, des sous-vêtements et des tissus bazins à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est au Nigéria et à Lomé, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Rafiatou achète ses articles. Rafiatou a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face aux exigences de sa clientèle et à leur demande sans cesse croissante, Rafiatou désire renforcer son activité et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pourquoi Rafiatou sollicite un second crédit.
texts.en:
R. Rafiatou was born on September 8, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to AKILOCHO Idrissou and is the mother of one child, who is in school. For seven years, she has been living with her child in the Adogléta district in Cotonou. To provide for herself and her child, Rafiatou sells outfits for children, undergarments, and damask cloth at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She purchases her goods in Lomé and from Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. She has already had an ALIDé loan and has carried out the repayment of it. Facing the requirements of her customers and their ever-growing demands, Rafiatou would like to bolster her business and to increase her sales. This is why she is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing for children, undergarments, and fabrics

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph D. is from the town of San Pablo. He is 41 years old. Joseph is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joseph raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) whenever he sells an animal he has raised.

In 2009, Joseph joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the third loan taken out by Joseph from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 47 years old and is married with two school-aged children.

Digna operates a family member's business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to increase the size of her harvest.

Digna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Digna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed and fertilizer. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy R. is from the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Mercy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de huevos, ella tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende los huevos desde las 7.00 a.m  hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los huevos y también poder vender productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceites. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos al por mayor. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Kukuli community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and department.

The member is Cristina. She is 52 years old and is a single mother and has one child. The member alternates her daily activities between buying and selling eggs. She has a small stall where she sells eggs from 7AM until 5PM. She wishes to have a shop from which to sell the ggs and also to be able to sell products like rice, sugar, milk and oils. She is requesting the loan to purchase eggs at wholesale prices.

She is thankful to those who are part of this dream in this manner and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a farmer from Kitale in western Kenya.  She is 37 years old and a single mother of four children who are between the ages of nine and eighteen. Three of the children are currently attending school. Winny has been farming for six years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and maize which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her service as a dip attendant. Her primary challenge has been lack of enough animal feed.

She has requested this loan of 31,200KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help her purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In the future, she plans to buy three dairy cows and a posho mill.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Augusto Salvador

texts.pt:
Augusto Salvador S. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 14 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 6ªclasse não concluiu devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo com a sua esposa refugiando se da guerra. Atualmente trabalha como auxiliar de segurança da empresa SOEIRO COMERCIAL ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 3.250.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa muito pouco devido as despesas que tem excedido suas necessidades.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com outros clientes da Instituição. Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, pedra, cimento, barrotes e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 8.500.00mt aplicado no comércio. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades para aceder a mais empréstimos para poder terminar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Augusto Salvador S. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  He has two children, ages 12 and 14.  Both children go to school.  Augusto went through sixth grade but did not finish school because of the civil war.  He lives in his own house and supports no one outside of his family.

He left Chibuto to move to Maputo with his wife while seeking refuge from the war.  He currently works as a security assistant at the Soeiro Business company and has been there more than five years.  He has a salary of 3,250 meticais, which he uses for household expenses.  He saves very little because he has had extra expenses.

Augusto never had loans from other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through conversations with other customers of the Institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 10,300 meticais to buy construction materials (iron, stone, cement, beams and other items) so he can continue construction on his house.  The previous loan was for 8,500 meticais and was used for business.

Augusto is confident that he will pay off the loan with no difficulties so he can take out more loans to finish his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (iron, stone, cement, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 40 años de edad ,conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de comida ,siendo su hijo mayor quien la apoya en este negocio, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00am hasta las 7:00pm  . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su restaurante  para comprar insumos para cocinar como arroz , aceite.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  Her eldest son supports her in the business.  She works from 7.00am to 7.00pm.

She is requesting this loan to keep her restaurant in operation, buying cooking ingredients such as rice and oil.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep her restaurant in operation, to buy cooking ingredients such as rice and oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a dairy products shop for over 5 years. He offers all types of dairy products in addition to Lebanese products made from milk. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. He is the only income provider for his family. 

He opened this type of shop after seeing much need for such a business in the region. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to further develop his shop and increase his productivity.  He is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. His shop is an important source of income for his family.

loans.use: to further develop his shop and increase his productivity

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María Z. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en la comunidad de Guariviña que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es reconocida por ser el mirador de la ciudad ya que desde allí se puede observar  gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.
Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la desempeña hace 8 meses y le va bien por el momento.
 
Doña María es una mujer muy joven tiene 20 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo  de 3 años de edad y  un bebe de días de nacido, su esposo trabaja como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo gastos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la desempeña hace 8 meses y le va bien por el momento.
 
La Señora. María se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene buenas amigas con quienes se distrae y sale de la rutina cada quince días, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos. Su meta es estudiar para estilista para tener una profeción.
texts.en:
Mrs María Z. is a member of the 'Narancay Bajo' community bank.  She lives in Guariviña, in Turi parish.  This parish is known as the viewpoint of the city since from there you can see a large part of the city of Cuenca.  The people of this area raise animals and farm.  A large part of the population also works in the city in different jobs.

María is 20 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has a 3 year-old child and a baby who is just a few days old.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  She doesn't have her own home so lives in her mom's house, sharing expenses.

María raises chickens.  She has been doing this for 8 months and right now her business is doing well.

This is María's second loan through her community bank and she likes it because she has good friends there with whom she has fun and escapes from her daily routine every fortnight.  She will invest her loan in buying chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to study to become a stylist so that she has a profession.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fany Monica; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ropa, ella confecciona todo tipo de ropa como pantalones, blusas y vestidos, la socia estudia y trabaja, ella quiere seguir aprendiendo a confeccionar mas tipo de ropa, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender la ropa que confecciona. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Comuzone I communal bank, located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province in Cusco department.
She is Fany Monica, 23, and single.  She alternates her daily activities with a dressmaking business.  She makes all types of clothes such as pants, blouse and dresses.  The member studies and works and she wants to continue learning dressmaking for many kinds of clothes.  She would like to have a store where she can sell the clothing that she makes.  Fany Monica is requesting a loan to buy material that she can use to sew the clothes.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 21 سنة اعزب ويحب عمله يعمل في رسم الوشم على الاجساد في منزله له في عمله 4 سنوات طموح ويحب ان 
يساعد اهله ويحسن ضعه المالي والاجتماعي وتحقيق حلمه بأن يكون له مركز تجميل خاص له يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
الى استئجار محل خاص له لكي يوسع المصلحة ويزيد من عدد زبائنه فهو محب للعمل وزبائنه يقصدونه ويسعى دائما الى
تأمين الاماكن لتتسع لأكبر عدد من الزبائن
texts.en: Hasan, 31, is single and self employed.  He has a passion for tattooing, an occupation he has been working at for 4 years.  Hasan supports his family and wants to improve his financial and social status.  Hasan is ambitious. He currently works from home but he wishes to fulfill his dream of having his own shop. He seeks a loan from Al Majmoua to rent a shop so as to expand his business and increase his clients. Hasan loves his work and enjoys his clients' trust. He wishes to be able to secure more room for more clients.

loans.use: To rent a shop for his tattoo business

loans.name: Flor Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, ella tiene 34  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro en aluminio y vidrio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días a cualquier hora ya que no tiene un horario fijo ya que cambia de acuerdo a sus necesidades, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen desde el exterior y ella misma la va a comprar cuando necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin muchos tramites. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que en la actualidad alquila.
texts.en:
The members of the San Jorge Village Bank meet every 15 days in the San Jorge neighborhood of Portoviejo, a beautiful city surrounded by green mountains and amazing vistas.
 
Here we met Señora Flor, who is 34 years old. She is married and she and her husband have two children, 17 and 19 years old, who are still in school. Her husband works with metal and glass, building and repairing windows and doors.

She sells all kinds of clothing door-to-door, and also has a small shop in her house. She tells us her customers order things from her. She works every day, but she doesn't have a set schedule so she can work whenever she's needed. She sells to her customers on credit and they make payments every 15 days. She gets her merchandise from abroad, and she buys it, too, when she needs it.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, especially women's clothing such as pants, blouses, lingerie, etc. She's been a member of the village bank for two loan cycles, and she likes it because she receives the loans quickly and without as much hassle. Her dream is to have her own home, since she is renting at the moment.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing such as pants, blouses, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion A. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Presentacion is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of manufacturing and selling specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. 

Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Jenny Elizabeth, ella tiene 45 años, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. La señora Jenny se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los cuales distribuye generalmente de forma ambulante, también en su casa realiza ventas, las cuales en su mayoría son a crédito. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Este negocio le ha servido como fuente de ingresos para ella y para la manutención de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, pinturas, brillos entre otros. Ella posee el sueño de hacer que el negocio crezca lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny Elizabeth is 45 years old and has one minor child.  She has a business selling cosmetics which she either distributes herself or sells out of her home, mostly on a credit basis.  She began this activity because she had no other income and couldn't find a job.

This business has been a source of income for her and the family.  She plans to use the loan to buy lipstick, creams, make-up and eye-shadow.  Her dream is to grow her business enough in the near future to be able to make home improvements.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Ilseyar

texts.en:
Ilseyar is divorced. She raises two children: a 13-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. She sells retail items (i.e., camera accessories, office and school supplies) in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown of Kahovka. Ilseyar has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, she has 16,000 Ukraine Hryvnia (UAH) invested in inventory. Her net profit is about 6,000 UAH a month. 

Ilseyar is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to use as working capital to buy necessary inventory and increase her assortment of merchandise. Ilseyar has used micro loans before and found them very helpful for her business growth.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Marana

texts.en:
Marana is 48 years old and married with five children.

Marana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marana has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marana aspires to help her children and grandchildren by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 40 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 20. She is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, where she has been farming for 15 years. Alice's farm produces vegetables, bananas, eggs and milk, which are all sold locally.
Alice has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand her poultry farming business. The extra income from this loan will enable her to provide for the basic needs of her family. She faces the challenge of pests and diseases, but is optimistic that in the next five years her poultry farm will have expanded despite these challenges.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farming business

loans.name: Polotbek's Group

texts.en:
Polotbek T. is a member of this group. He is 45 and married. His wife went to work in Russia to make money. Polotbek takes care of three children: a daughter and two sons. The youngest son studies at school and the other children help their dad with housework. Polotbek works as a specialist in the Migration Department.  His monthly salary is 4400 soms.  In order to earn additional money to meet his family needs, Polobek breeds livestock. With the  money received from the loan he wants to purchase sheep for breeding.  In the future Polotbek wants to purchase an apartment for his children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una persona muy respetuosa y  responsable en esta  ocasión  requiere el préstamo porque desea comprar mercancía para su negocio ya  que  actualmente ella  se  dedica  a la  venta  de ropa usada ,    ve  en el crédito la posibilidad de poder  ofrecer  una  mejor    variedad  de  productos  a  sus  clientes  así  como también    una  estabilidad  económica   a su  familia.
texts.en: Claudia is a very respectful and responsible person. She now requires a loan because she would like to buy merchandise for her business. She currently sells used clothing and she sees the loan as a chance to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, as well as to provide her family with more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est née le 11 janvier 1966 au Bénin. Justine est mariée à un gendarme du nom de Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Justine vient en aide à son mari grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la famille. Justine à fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Depuis sept  ans, Justine vend des céréales (maïs, sorgho, soja, haricot, etc.). Justine achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Justine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Justine was born January 11, 1966 in Benin. She is married to a gendarme named Joseph. The couple supports three children, all in school. Justine helps her husband thanks to the income she makes from her business, paying jointly with him the various family expenses.

Justine attended school until high school. For seven years she has been selling cereals (corn, sorghum, soy, beans, etc.). She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the fourth time that Justine has sought a loan through ALIDé. The loan will serve to raise the level of her business activity in order to better meet the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Justo  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Justo antonio,vive en departamento de Managua,es una persona social, amable de buenos valores morales, trabahjadora, para darle una mejor acondicion y estabilida a su familia.

El señor justo  visito nuestras instalaciones para solicitar un crédito por que quiere ocupar una parte del dinero que ceprodel le va prestar lo va a invertir en las mejoras de su vivienda, en levantar una pared en su sala, compra materiales tales como cemento, arena , bloque y otra parte del dinero lo va a invertí  en compra de una refrigeradora por que quiere poner un pequeño negocio.
El señor se siente agradecido con ceprodel por darle la oportunidad de hacer realidad sus sueño por que gracias a los prestamos obtenidos en ceprodel ha podido mejoras su condiciones en su vivienda
texts.en:
Justo Antonio lives in the department of Managua. He is a social and kind person with good moral values. He works hard to provide his family with better living conditions and greater stability. 

Justo can to your offices to request a loan. A part of the funds that Ceprodel will loan him will be invested in making home improvements, to build a wall in his living room. He will purchase materials such as cement, sand, construction blocks and other materials. Another part of the loan will be invested in the purchase of a freezer to start up a business. He feels thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for giving him an opportunity to make his dreams a reality. It is thanks to loans obtained from Ceprodel he has been ale to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela owns a kindergarten and preschool. She started her project seven years ago, Naela enjoys her work and dealing with the children, Naela wants to replace the old furniture in the classrooms and playrooms. Naela took out a loan from FATEN to replace the old furniture and purchase educational toys.

Naela, who is photographed here, hopes in the future to have an elementary school besides the kindergarten and preschool.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and educational toys

loans.name: Khasrat

texts.en:
Khasrat, 35, is married and has two children. 

He sells food items in a grocery store that is located in a very busy place, the Agsu central bazaar. That is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Khasrat. He has been running this business for seven years.

Khasrat’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet their needs. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. 

Lending services from AqroInvest Credit Union have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Now his monthly income is 300 USD and he would like to increase it. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to purchase more food items and increase his monthly profit. Khasrat is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to increase profits.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and has four children. Lourdes is married and one of her children is in school. Lourdes has been farming vegetables for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Lourdes requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik sells shoes in a rented booth at the city market. 

Shushanik dreams of renovating her house and providing necessary education for her growing sons. For these reasons, she plans to increase the variety of shoes she sells and further develop her business. With the requested loan Shushanik plans to purchase more shoes to sell. Additional income will help Shushanik to ensure a sustainable future for her family. 

Shushanik lives with her husband, pensioner father-in-law, and two sons.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.
